name: The Waffle Cafe
description: A great place to get some delicious savory waffles as well as some sweet ones.

This little pick up and go spot on the Hiriketiya beach has defiantly been in operation for a good few months despite being shit down once or twice for illegally occupying the beach. Their value for money drinks deserve a mention.
name: 'Cocktails/Juices' (Unnamed Beach Bar, Hiriketiya)

description: A concept store with a great collection of resort wear and bikinis.
name: Lagoon Lab
Navro Beach Restaurant
description: Navro Beach is one of the most popular restaurants in Panadura area, if you want to have a relaxed evening with some drinks and delicious food.

name: Sea Breeze Seafood Restaurant
description: Great simple Sri Lankan and fusion/international food on Hiriketiya beach.

name: Hasara Kitchen
description: Hasara Kitchen is a popular spot in Nugegoda, that dishes out some okay rice and curry for a decent price tag.

name: Himsara Foods
description: A great place to grab some good rice and curry, along with a killer pork curry.

name: Cafe Kumbuk
description: Simple and healthy, Kumbuk does everything right with local, seasonal and organic ingredients.

name: Salwa Turkish Food
description: A tiny food joint down Albert Place, Dehiwala that serves up some good street food for very cheap prices.

name: Hulftsdorp Streetfood
address: Abdul Hameed Street, between Quarry Road and Oilman's Street
description: A street with a wide variety of food in the center of industrial Colombo. Find everything from mutton brain curry to devilled cuttlefish eggs.
Staying at the Equator Village gives you a neat balance between the resort experience and local life in the Maldives
address: S.Gan, Addu City, Rep of Maldives, 19010, Maldives
name: Equator Village, Gan Island
We Ai Family
description: An authentic Chinese restaurant serving huge portions of rice and noodles.

name: The Cabinet (Hotel Nippon)
description: The bar and lounge of historic Hotel Nippon

name: Wayne's Junction
description: A cafe that seems to have Australian inspired dishes, as well as local delicacies. Only on paper, as it turned out.

name: The Gallery Café
description: The Gallery Cafe is one of those perpetually hip spots in Colombo. The ambience is one of a kind and the  food is consistently good, but it will leave a dent in your wallet.

name: Wayne's Junction
description: A cafe that seems to have Australian inspired dishes, as well as local delicacies. Only on paper, as it turned out.

name: Mathura Restaurant
description: Mathura is a decent Indian vegetarian restaurant that has been around Colombo for years, but now at a new location.

name: Bombay Sweet Mahal (Wellawatte)
description: Bombay Sweet Mahal is one of many shops selling Indian sweets and fruit juice in Wellawatte. What sets it apart are their special offerings, like the multi-layered fruit cocktail (Rs. 290) and the seasonal durian juice.

As the name suggests, a good place for generous burgers. Generous means that the burgers are big and have good cuts of meat, including lamb. The vegetarian burger here is also quite respectable. It's a big, fat mushroom and quite satisfying even for carnivores.
name: Burger Blast
Harbour Room (Grand Oriental Hotel)
description: One of the best views anywhere in the city or the region, in an incredibly under-rated colonial property.

name: Flower Drum
description: Good ambience, decent food, over-rated chili paste. Okay value for groups.

name: Sakura Japanese
description: You've heard of Sri Lankan Chinese food, but Sri Lankan Japanese?  Well it exists and using the island's abundance of fresh sea food, Sakura has been serving up consistently good and affordable Japanese dishes since 1983.

name: Malay Restaurant
description: Malay Restaurant in Dehiwala is hugely popular, and after trying our their stuff we can see why. The portions: massive, the flavours: excellent and the prices: reasonable.

name: Paan Paan
description: Paan Paan is an excellent bread shop off Duplication Road. They've got superb takes on European loaves and pastries.

name: Paan Paan
description: Paan Paan is an excellent bread shop off Duplication Road. They've got superb takes on European loaves and pastries.

The Cargills Food City on Staple Street is one of the city's best supermarkets. It was the chain's first outlet, and has been around since 1983. It's large and offers a wider variety of products than most other stores. No promises, but you can probably satisfy most of your culinary requirements here.
name: Cargills Food City - Staple Street

description: Colombo Courtyard is a business hotel which also serves as one of the city's hippest new bars.
name: Colombo Courtyard

description: White Horse has always been a playground for Colombo's underage, bright young things. It's also been a playground for Colombo's not-so-bright things. Which probably explains why the occasional fight breaks out: the big bundied, arrack drinking men in the corner may toss a comment at the girls whose male counterparts then indignantly intervene...you know how the rest goes.
name: White Horse Inn
Ministry Of Crab (Dutch Hospital)
description: Ministry of Crab is a high-end restaurant on Dutch Hospital premises that specializes in crab cuisine - the food is just plain mouth-watering and the service is good.
Chapters has a decent range of books, mostly fantasy and illustration, but what we really love about this bookshop is it's so much more than a store.
name: Chapters

description: Ramani’s is a nice place and a good salon. It won't give you for money, but they're reliable and probably won’t ruin your hair. The staff – at the Nugegoda branch at least – are lovely. They haven’t changed in years, they remember all their clients and they’re just really, really sweet and friendly.
name: Ramani Fernando Salon

description: The EAP is a low-key, relaxed place for a tipple. It's near the Borella junction.
address: 20 Dr. N. M. Perera Mawatha, Borella, Colombo 8
name: EAP Restaurant

description: It was with cautious expectations that we visited the Kohuwela Roots. But here, we're happy to say, the service is good and the juices, superb. The little glass cube jutting out of Tisara Plaza is clean and nice; the staff don't stand around gormlessly and they can serve up a swift and delicious cold strawberry juice (Rs. 220).
name: Roots (Kohuwala)

description: Pagoda Tea Rooms is basically the only place to chill out at on Chatham Street - it's in a lovely building from all the way back in 1884. They do a super lamprais, and fun fact: Duran Duran shot a music video here.
name: Pagoda Tea Rooms

description: At the point where Jambugasmulla runs into Old Kesbewa Road lies AMRO Vegetarian Cafe, a little oasis of calm amidst the noisy Nugegoda soundscape. Run by four charming aunties, AMRO serves up your basic kade style Sri Lankan food - except not in a kade.
name: Amro Vegetarian Cafe

description: The Island Coffee shop is so utterly charming and captures perfectly the spirit of a Colombo that is now slipping from the collective memory - an age where nothing was imported and everything had to be local.
name: The Island Coffee Shop

description: Its a bit of a lucky a dip but sift through the dusty collections for long enough ask the enthusiastic vendors enough questions and after 30 mins scouring you're sure to find something you like.
name: Maradana Second Hand Book Shops
Klassy Pastry Shop
address: 2B De Fonseka Road, Colombo, Sri Lanka
description: Klassy is a really good pastry shop - reliable for savouries and milk toffees.

A couple of years ago the once gentle gathering of music lovers turned into something of a socialite scene, overrun by adolescents ducking for cigarettes behind plastic chairs and the chatter of patrons bubbling over the smooth, sashaying sounds of the sax.
name: Sunday Jazz At CR&FC

description: The Planetarium is one of those places in Colombo that's stayed more or less the same since 1965, give or take a bit of furniture revamping and their new website. The building still looks fantastic, the feeling you get when the lights dim is still exciting, most of the graphics are unfortunately still outdated, and the ticket is still just cheap.
name: Sri Lanka Planetarium
Hotel De Pilawoos (Kollupitiya)
description: Hotel de Pilawoos, one of the many Hotel de Pilawoos, is probably the best Hotel de Pilwaoos in town.
Formerly known as Walkers Cafe, The Canteen hasn't changed much at all but their hoppers are excellent.
name: The Canteen

description: Pagoda Tea Rooms is basically the only place to chill out at on Chatham Street - it's in a lovely building from all the way back in 1884. They do a super lamprais, and fun fact: Duran Duran shot a music video here.
name: Pagoda Tea Rooms

description: While it's not quite as charming as Maradana's second hand strip it's much better laid out and the books seems to be curated- classics at the back, pulp and pop towards the front and a box of more serious contemporary novels on one side.
name: Senanayake Book Shop

description: The Supun Arcade on Galle Road is probably Colombo's cleanest and emptiest mall. It's actually eerie because the stores are fully stocked, computers, phones and (inexplicably) Chinese vases on the first floor; a fullish department store up top. There also seems to be ample parking below. Just no people.
name: Supun Arcade

description: We give Fork a cautious recommendation for the food and location, but they really need to address basic cleanliness and comfort. It's a good addition to a road (Marine Drive) that we hope to see blossom soon.
name: Fork Restaurant & Cafe

description: This is somewhere my grandmother remembers buying bits and bobs from 50 years ago, I saw their sign and expected to find the place empty and derelict but amazingly it's alive and almost well.... sorta like finding a living dinosaur.
name: The New Chinese Shop

description: Christmas is coming so here's a random gift idea - buy your loved one/child/friend a telescope.
name: Batik Center
Min Han
description: Min Han (or Ming Han) is one of our favorite Chinese restaurants. It's cheap, super tasty and the waiter Wijapayala orders for you.

Machan is something of a godsend if you don’t reside within happy proximity to Colombo’s more central drinking establishments - tukking up to Fort or Colpetty from the lowly ‘burbs can be an expensive, exhaust-filled drag.
name: Machang (Nawala)

description: The Planetarium is one of those places in Colombo that's stayed more or less the same since 1965, give or take a bit of furniture revamping and their new website. The building still looks fantastic, the feeling you get when the lights dim is still exciting, most of the graphics are unfortunately still outdated, and the ticket is still just cheap.
name: Sri Lanka Planetarium
Nalapaham
description: Nalapaham is for those of you with a sudden mid-day craving for crab - besides the biriyani, idiyapam and kottu, they serve tasty crab, cheap.

name: Big Bite Biryani
address: 124, S De S Jayasinghe Road, Kohuwala.
description: The chicken was excellent, but it took them half an hour so we would have been pretty enraged if it wasn't. The actual biryani though, for us this is the rich saffron and meat infused rice, was disappointing.

name: Hotel De Pilawoos (Kollupitiya)
description: Hotel de Pilawoos, one of the many Hotel de Pilawoos, is probably the best Hotel de Pilwaoos in town.
Panorama is a bar cum restaurant that we don't love as a restaurant, though we have heard good things about the bar. Come here at sunset for the view and don't be too picky about anything else.
name: Panorama (Colombo City Hotel)

description: We give Fork a cautious recommendation for the food and location, but they really need to address basic cleanliness and comfort. It's a good addition to a road (Marine Drive) that we hope to see blossom soon.
name: Fork Restaurant & Cafe

description: The Tamil Union is one of our older, more interesting clubs with a strong and loving relationship to Sri Lanka cricket. Existing before even our grandparents were born - since 1899 - the P. Saravanamuttu Stadium hosted Sri Lanka's first ever international test match in 1982.
address: P Sara Oval Stadium, 301 Leslie Ranagala Mawatha, Colombo 8,
name: The Tamil Union Cricket & Athletic Club
Lani's Sea Food Restaurant
description: Between a Maldivian restaurant and a playground is a strip of sand that leads to a broad beach and the Indian ocean. Lani's decorated fishing boat will be on your left. The entrance is behind the boat.

The Qbaa bar - not restaurant - is a pretty cool place to be. Walking in feels like stepping through the magic wardrobe - out of Colombo and into a vibrant city with a bubbling late night music scene. Kind of like the bar cellars of Montreal or London
name: Qbaa (Bar)
Sponge
description: Sponge is one of the oldest bakeries in the big city, and one of the biggest. They are still going strong with a quality range of savouries and sweets, and now also lamprais and gourmet sandwiches.

name: Meal Centre
address: 36 S. D. S. Jayasinghe Mawatha (Hospital Road), Kalubowila
description: Clean, tidy and located on the side of the road with a broad car park, you can spot Damith from afar by its curling yellow logo. A welcome change from the abundance of Wonder Bakeries - really not so wonderful - Damith provides honest, tasty Sri Lankan food.

Their special is the CBP and it's really pretty special. A rich but not heavy mousse, an intense and lasting chocolate hit, a fair lug of alcohol and biscuit perfection- not too mushy not too crunchy.
name: Decadence

description: Overcome any superstitions about graveyards you might harbor  and step in.
name: Jawatte Cemetery

description: The best beach in Sri Lanka. That's a bold claim but I'll stand by it. I've been beach hunting in out of the way parts of the country for years and I've never found anything that surpasses Marble Beach.
name: Marble Beach Airforce Resort

description: If you're looking for a different Christmas gift this season, why not some milk toffee from Nandi's.
name: Nandi's Milk Toffee

description: Rainco has a big shop in Dehiwala selling everything from (expensive) patio furniture and awnings to affordable camping equipment and umbrellas.
name: The World Of Outdoor

description: Their special is the CBP and it's really pretty special. A rich but not heavy mousse, an intense and lasting chocolate hit, a fair lug of alcohol and biscuit perfection- not too mushy not too crunchy.
name: Decadence

description: Milk & Honey has impressive healthy food options, and really pleasant ambience. Also some of the best brownies in the city.
name: Milk & Honey Cafe

description: The wetland park has quite literally changed the face of the town overnight. From its former existence as an unlovely tangle of ill-planned shops and houses, there's finally something pretty in Nugegoda - somewhere to go besides the trifecta of trash McDonalds, Pizza Hut or KFC.
name: Urban Wetland Park (Nugegoda)
Green Cabin
description: Providing the city with crispy white hoppers and tongue burning katta sambol for well over 60 years, Green Cabin is one of Colombo's older, more venerable eating establishments.

Toby's Estate in Mount Lavinia is a very cosy hangout that serves okay-food that's a little on the pricey side - this international franchise is still best known in Colombo as a coffee stop rather than for its dine-in.
address: Galle Road, Dehiwala-Mount Lavinia, Sri Lanka
name: Toby's Estate
Lucky Star
description: Even without the exclusively Chinese clientele and waiting staff you'd know it was a mainland restaurant from the quality of the tofu- just softer and silkier than locally-run restaurants can achieve.
for bespoke clothing, at a reasonable price from a central location Raheema's is a pretty good option.
name: Raheema's Tailors

description: Many Colomboars aren't aware this historical building exists, but it still stands.
name: General Post Office

description: The Qbaa bar - not restaurant - is a pretty cool place to be. Walking in feels like stepping through the magic wardrobe - out of Colombo and into a vibrant city with a bubbling late night music scene. Kind of like the bar cellars of Montreal or London
name: Qbaa (Bar)

description: On Hospital Road in Dehiwala, there is a somewhat awesome Feng Shui shop. Here you can get huge, weighty laughing Budai, dragon or pagoda statues, or amulets (including exam amulets) and books and content from Feng Shui Master Asiri Wanigaratne.
address: 29A S De S Jayasinghe Mawatha, Dehiwala
name: Feng Shui Collection

description: What makes this particular temple so attractive is its relative lack of adornment and extraneous features.
name: Metharamaya Temple

description: Serving fish and chips as well as the mandatory Sri Lankan buth packets, F&C does their name justice by actually doing what they claim to do quite well. For best results, however, just take away.
name: Fish & Chips

description: The wetland park has quite literally changed the face of the town overnight. From its former existence as an unlovely tangle of ill-planned shops and houses, there's finally something pretty in Nugegoda - somewhere to go besides the trifecta of trash McDonalds, Pizza Hut or KFC.
name: Urban Wetland Park (Nugegoda)

description: Coco Veranda on Ward Place is one of Colombo's most popular coffee shops. We loved them in the past, but this time around it was a let down.
name: Coco Veranda
Spaghetti & Co
description: This Hikkaduwa institution does decent Italian.

The Southern Expressway opened two gleaming service stations near Welipenna. Each houses a Cargills Food City and assorted shops like Juiceez, Dinemore, Gihan's, Gill's, Pascucci and New Monis. They also have ATMs and quite decent bathrooms.
name: Southern Expressway Service Area (Canonwin Arcade)

description: Just being able to stand in a space that someone from the 17th century would still recognize is worth the Rs 20  admission charge.
name: Dutch Period Museum
Rolex Hotel
description: Rolex Hotel is a Jaffna bath kade in Wellawatte which also seems to have a branch in Jaffna.

What's bubble tea? Tea with bubbles? Bubbles with tea? Sort of. It's actually as delightful as it sounds. A tea-based Taiwanese drink, the 'bubbles' are little black pearls of tapioca added to the tea.
name: Bubble Queen

description: As far as getting to touch, feel and buy the latest phones and tabs, the Etisalat HQ is the newest and best on the block.
address: Rotunda Towers, No.109, Galle Road, Colombo 03.
name: Etisalat HQ

description: or me, this is really the best place to stay in the vicinity of Sigiriya. Well designed mud and wood cottages in the middle of the jungle that, with their open and swank modern bathroom fixtures manage to feel almost luxurious.
name: Back Of Beyond (Dehigahaela, Sigiriya)
Fazly's Halal Refreshment
description: Fazly's Halal Refreshment is one of Colombo's most popular streetside haunts, known for their delicious, mayo dripping, affordable fare.

name: Rolex Hotel
description: Rolex Hotel is a Jaffna bath kade in Wellawatte which also seems to have a branch in Jaffna.

name: Meal Centre
address: 36 S. D. S. Jayasinghe Mawatha (Hospital Road), Kalubowila
description: Clean, tidy and located on the side of the road with a broad car park, you can spot Damith from afar by its curling yellow logo. A welcome change from the abundance of Wonder Bakeries - really not so wonderful - Damith provides honest, tasty Sri Lankan food.

The best beach in Sri Lanka. That's a bold claim but I'll stand by it. I've been beach hunting in out of the way parts of the country for years and I've never found anything that surpasses Marble Beach.
name: Marble Beach Airforce Resort

description: It looks like England's lake district or New Zealand. In fact Ambewala's marketing tag is - little New Zealand, and unlike certain little Rome's and Englands we have in this country the name isn't a flight a fancy;
name: Ambewala Farm

description: If you're looking for a different Christmas gift this season, why not some milk toffee from Nandi's.
name: Nandi's Milk Toffee

description: If you're looking for cheap sunglasses, the Galle Road is perhaps the best place. Right across from Majestic City there's a stall which sells reliably cheap sunglasses (Rs. 200-500, depending on negotiation skills) which, while potentially bad for your eyes, often look good.
name: Random Sunglass Hut

description: laptop.lk is a website, but also a series of physical branches where you can buy a range of laptops. YAMU needed a laptop for coding and we managed to find one within our specs for Rs. 53,800. Which really isn't bad, and the store and staff are nice.
name: laptop.lk

description: The lighthouse provides stunning views of the Indian Ocean. From its raised base you can see all the way down the Galle Face Green to the Galle Face Hotel and right across to the very tip of the horizon.
name: Galle Buck Lighthouse
Fazly's Halal Refreshment
description: Fazly's Halal Refreshment is one of Colombo's most popular streetside haunts, known for their delicious, mayo dripping, affordable fare.

name: Crossroads
description: Crossroads, run by Tasty Caterers, is a good restaurant. With a funny menu dancing across a variety of cuisines (Thai, Western, Mexican, Italian, Sri Lankan) the food, while not authentic, lives up to the name of its proprietors and actually is quite tasty.
As a bonus the couple who run the guesthouse cook up some pretty excellent meals – so you can even over come the Kandy food issue….
name: Forest Glen, Kandy

description: This interesting temple in interesting Kotahena is a unique blend of Thai, colonial and local architecture. It's also the oldest Buddhist temple in Colombo.
address: Deepaduttaramaya, Kotahena Street and Mayfield, Kotahena
name: Deepaduttaramaya Temple

description: A few minutes of browsing in Melache you'll see that local labels are no longer a laughing matter. There are some really lovely pieces in this shop and they are very well priced. Original and handmade creations for as little as Rs 1500.
name: Melaché

description: Well you really can’t do one without the other - Mount Lavinia Hotel and the Galle Face Hotel are Colombo’s colonial duo. So we headed to the GFH’s famed salt water pool. That’s right, no chlorine here, but salt so you get a bit of added buoyancy and less of that horrid chorine smell.
name: Galle Face Hotel (Pool)
Colombo's No. 1 Chuanr Stall
description: For a bit of urban adventure/anthropology in your own backyard this is an excellent and tasty excursion and it is so central- 17th lane is just near Colpetty junction that you dont need to go too far out of your way..

Of Colombo’s 5 star hotel pools we are partial to the one at Cinnamon Lakeside. It’s probably the most  recently refurbished of the big hotel pools and with its Beira-side views, deep blue tinge, and innovative U-shape it makes for better swimming than your average hotel pool.
address: 115, Sir Chittampalam A. Gardiner Mawatha, Colombo 2
name: Cinnamon Lakeside (Pool)
Klassy Pastry Shop
address: 2B De Fonseka Road, Colombo, Sri Lanka
description: Klassy is a really good pastry shop - reliable for savouries and milk toffees.

name: VOC Cafe (Dutch Burgher Union)
description: The VOC is a one of the best places in the city to get lamprais, and we've heard their burgers are pretty good too.

name: Yaal Restaurant
description: Yaal Restaurant down Marine Drive still serves some very tasty and not-too-pricey food, and their crab curry is still good - though it's their biriyani that blew us away.

name: Colombo's No. 1 Chuanr Stall
description: For a bit of urban adventure/anthropology in your own backyard this is an excellent and tasty excursion and it is so central- 17th lane is just near Colpetty junction that you dont need to go too far out of your way..

For high-end but not unaffordable Sarees check out Aashkii. There are also dresses and random bits of home-wear available in the split level premise on top of Maitland Crescent though these didnt seem as promising as the Sarees.
name: Aashkii

description: The Castle Hotel is the finest of dodgy bars.
name: The Castle Hotel

description: Breeze Bar at Cinnamon Grand is one of Colombo's most popular poolside bars, and it's a great place to chill with some friends. The food is good, but the drinks are pricier than most other places.
name: Breeze Bar (Cinnamon Grand)
Carino Ice Cream
description: With both selling their goods on the open market the stage is set for open confrontation. It;s the established Corleones (Il Gelato) vs  the up and coming Tattaglias (Carinos) and of course YAMU is caught in the cross fire.

We've had quite a few new ice cream parlors pop up over the past few years (no complaints from us!), but Il Gelato still reigns supreme when it comes to high quality ice cream. There's just this small issue of having to empty your wallet for a few scoops..
name: Il Gelato
Hotel De Buhari
description: Local biryani doesn’t seem to get the attention it deserves.  If you think about it though those plates of saffron tinged rice are a central part of life for millions of Sri Lankans.
The Castle Hotel is the finest of dodgy bars.
name: The Castle Hotel
VOC Cafe (Dutch Burgher Union)
description: The VOC is a one of the best places in the city to get lamprais, and we've heard their burgers are pretty good too.

The K-9 is, I think, Colombo's only attempt at a comprehensive pet store. They sell a whole bunch of pet related products like cages, leashes, chew toys, and, strangely, adult diapers (?). You can purchase items for mosts house pets but the shop seems better catered towards the eponymous canine.
name: The K-9

description: Spice is a peculiar yet charming little restaurant located off the dusty, exhaust-filled Galle Road.  Screened by a painted concrete slab, a passing glance from a tuk is likely to overlook the large dining space concealed behind. The restaurant slash kade hiding beyond the colourful wall is housed under an aluminium canopy, held up by scaffolding and corrugated sheets of metal. Despite its minimal structure, however, Spice is really a rather pretty place to sit down for a meal.
name: Spice Restaurant
Big Bite Biryani
address: 124, S De S Jayasinghe Road, Kohuwala.
description: The chicken was excellent, but it took them half an hour so we would have been pretty enraged if it wasn't. The actual biryani though, for us this is the rich saffron and meat infused rice, was disappointing.

The Dehiwala Zoo is kind of depressing if you're an animal lover, ironically, because a lot of the animals live in sad situations here. Some of the animals have wider greener spaces to live in now though.
name: Dehiwala Zoo
Wijaya Beach
description: An old favourite, Wijaya Beach continues to serve up fresh seafood, excellent pizza and a sun-dappled ocean view.
This interesting temple in interesting Kotahena is a unique blend of Thai, colonial and local architecture. It's also the oldest Buddhist temple in Colombo.
address: Deepaduttaramaya, Kotahena Street and Mayfield, Kotahena
name: Deepaduttaramaya Temple

description: The Roti Stop is a classic down south destination. While there are numerous roti joints dotting the Galle Road by almost every tree and milespost, the Unawatuna Roti Stop is one of the more iconic of our unleavened bread spots.
name: The Roti Shop

description: The Tamil Union is one of our older, more interesting clubs with a strong and loving relationship to Sri Lanka cricket. Existing before even our grandparents were born - since 1899 - the P. Saravanamuttu Stadium hosted Sri Lanka's first ever international test match in 1982.
address: P Sara Oval Stadium, 301 Leslie Ranagala Mawatha, Colombo 8,
name: The Tamil Union Cricket & Athletic Club

description: Don's Deli is a little bakery on Marine Drive that doubles as a favourite spot for lamprais, and they also serve seafood at Fat Crab upstairs.
name: Don's Deli

description: 'Game Kade' does a really good rice and curry, pretty outstanding actually. The flavour and variety is immense, and I highly recommend it. Their Lamprais is pretty spot-on too.
address: Corner of Haig Road and Galle Road (seaside), Bambalapitiya, Colombo 4.
name: Game Kade
Perera & Sons
description: It must be said that somewhere on the journey from family bakers to mega-chain standards fell. The cream buns nowadays just arent the same

name: Greenlands Hotel
description: Greenlands is a budget South-Indian joint that wins for nostalgia.

name: Cafe Eklektik
description: Cafe Eklektik is a little courtyard canteen of sorts inside the German Cultural Center. It's good for lamprais, shorteats, fresh juices and some conversation under the trees.

name: Carino Ice Cream
description: With both selling their goods on the open market the stage is set for open confrontation. It;s the established Corleones (Il Gelato) vs  the up and coming Tattaglias (Carinos) and of course YAMU is caught in the cross fire.

The new Savoy 3D cinema is just...wow. It's huge, the seats aren't falling apart and the screen is HD. That's right, no more trembling, blurry projections. Just a crystal clear, blazingly vibrant, enormous screen.
address: 12 Savoy Building,  Galle Road, Wellawatte, Colombo 6
name: Savoy 3D Cinema
Sulthan Palace
address: 45A, C W W Kannangara Mawatha, Colombo 7
description: Sulthan Palace (formerly Rahumania) is a great spot at the Town Hall hub to get a delicious, cheap range of biriyanis, meats and even Sri Lankanized Chinese.

name: Hotel De Buhari
description: Local biryani doesn’t seem to get the attention it deserves.  If you think about it though those plates of saffron tinged rice are a central part of life for millions of Sri Lankans.
Its a bit of a lucky a dip but sift through the dusty collections for long enough ask the enthusiastic vendors enough questions and after 30 mins scouring you're sure to find something you like.
name: Maradana Second Hand Book Shops

description: The new Savoy 3D cinema is just...wow. It's huge, the seats aren't falling apart and the screen is HD. That's right, no more trembling, blurry projections. Just a crystal clear, blazingly vibrant, enormous screen.
address: 12 Savoy Building,  Galle Road, Wellawatte, Colombo 6
name: Savoy 3D Cinema

description: 'Game Kade' does a really good rice and curry, pretty outstanding actually. The flavour and variety is immense, and I highly recommend it. Their Lamprais is pretty spot-on too.
address: Corner of Haig Road and Galle Road (seaside), Bambalapitiya, Colombo 4.
name: Game Kade
Greenlands Hotel
description: Greenlands is a budget South-Indian joint that wins for nostalgia.
Don's Deli is a little bakery on Marine Drive that doubles as a favourite spot for lamprais, and they also serve seafood at Fat Crab upstairs.
name: Don's Deli

description: Viharamahadevi Park (VMDP) is Colombo's only major public park.  As such it’s a rather important place, providing the sole significant green space and lung for the city's 1 million + inhabitants.
name: Viharamahadevi Park (Old)

description: The EAP is a low-key, relaxed place for a tipple. It's near the Borella junction.
address: 20 Dr. N. M. Perera Mawatha, Borella, Colombo 8
name: EAP Restaurant

description: Saraswathie Lodge is another pure-veg South Indian spot on Galle Rd in Bambalapitiya. The ambience isn't as charming as nearby Greenlands Hotel but the thosai is marginally better.
name: Saraswathie Lodge (Bambalapitiya)

description: With Rs. 200 lattes and 250 cappuccinos Redwood, along with Hansa cafe, seems to advance the argument that coffee in Colombo can be good without breaking the bank.
name: Redwood Gallery/Coffee House
Qbaa
description: Qbaa is one of the more mature bars in Colombo, and they also house a fully fledged restaurant which is actually pretty great.
Viharamahadevi Park (VMDP) is Colombo's only major public park.  As such it’s a rather important place, providing the sole significant green space and lung for the city's 1 million + inhabitants.
name: Viharamahadevi Park (Old)

description: At the point where Jambugasmulla runs into Old Kesbewa Road lies AMRO Vegetarian Cafe, a little oasis of calm amidst the noisy Nugegoda soundscape. Run by four charming aunties, AMRO serves up your basic kade style Sri Lankan food - except not in a kade.
name: Amro Vegetarian Cafe

description: Work In Progress isn't just a random Lankan cafe serving up the burger/nasi goreng/pasta staples. The menu seems to veer quite strongly towards the Deutsch, offering the likes of schnitzel, bratwurst and brezel - the portmanteau used to denote a curious bread/pretzel union.
name: WIP (Work In Progress)

description: Even if you have nothing to to do with Anglicanism St Peters is fully worth visiting as one the city's oldest and most attractive buildings. An amazing and long-forgotten space that  quite desperately needs to be visited and loved again.
name: St Peters Church - Mission To Seafarers
Indian Chaat Corner
description: Indian Chaat Corner is a tiny barely-noticeable restaurant that specializes in Indian street food. The chaat is still pretty good, and they've got a nicer interior now.

The Kingsbury hotel is a massive unmistakable building if you're driving by Galle Face - it's one of the grander ones in the city, with an old Victorian theme (at least with the interior). The views from the hotel, especially from the rooftop bar, are pretty cool. And we thought the hotel deserved points for aesthetics, if the general vibe of extravagance doesn't put you off.
name: The Kingsbury

description: Coco Veranda on Ward Place is one of Colombo's most popular coffee shops. We loved them in the past, but this time around it was a let down.
name: Coco Veranda

description: Located in the outskirts of Colombo, Attidiya Bird Sanctuary is a small land (may be the only place near Colombo) for the birds and other animals to take refuge in. I was surprised at the biodiversity which I encountered for a place that is right in the backyard of Colombo city.
name: Attidiya Bird Sanctuary
Lunu Ambula
address: Ven. Muruththettuwe Ananda Himi Mawatha, Colombo 5
description: Lunu Ambula, on Thimbirigasyaya Road, is a buth kade with a rustic feel. Some are decent, others are outstanding.

name: McDonald's (Colombo Racecourse)
address: Race Course Ground, Philip Gunawadena Mawatha, Colombo 7
description: There isn't that much to say about the Racecourse McDonald's except that it's open and it's a McDonald's. It's the same as any other McDonald's except it's in the newly refurbished Colombo Racecourse grounds.

name: Raheema Hotel
address: Cumaratunga Munidasa Mawatha, Colombo, Sri Lanka
description: If you're in Colombo 7 and you're craving a good biriyani, Raheema is one of the first places that will come to mind. That's exactly the situation we found ourselves in, and we're glad we dropped in.

Even if you have nothing to to do with Anglicanism St Peters is fully worth visiting as one the city's oldest and most attractive buildings. An amazing and long-forgotten space that  quite desperately needs to be visited and loved again.
name: St Peters Church - Mission To Seafarers
Paradise (Sri Lankan Vegetarian Food Court)
description: Paradise is a convenient vegetarian rice and curry stop next to the Sri Sambuddhatva Jayanthi Mandira. It's easy on the wallet and they've also got a juice bar.
Chariot is an old Colombo standard now under new management. The changes seem to be going well. We only tried a rice and curry but the service, location and general feel of the place is good.
name: The Chariot (Dehiwala)

description: Located in the outskirts of Colombo, Attidiya Bird Sanctuary is a small land (may be the only place near Colombo) for the birds and other animals to take refuge in. I was surprised at the biodiversity which I encountered for a place that is right in the backyard of Colombo city.
name: Attidiya Bird Sanctuary
Paradise (Sri Lankan Vegetarian Food Court)
description: Paradise is a convenient vegetarian rice and curry stop next to the Sri Sambuddhatva Jayanthi Mandira. It's easy on the wallet and they've also got a juice bar.

The Southern Expressway opened two gleaming service stations near Welipenna. Each houses a Cargills Food City and assorted shops like Juiceez, Dinemore, Gihan's, Gill's, Pascucci and New Monis. They also have ATMs and quite decent bathrooms.
name: Southern Expressway Service Area (Canonwin Arcade)
Raheema Hotel
address: Cumaratunga Munidasa Mawatha, Colombo, Sri Lanka
description: If you're in Colombo 7 and you're craving a good biriyani, Raheema is one of the first places that will come to mind. That's exactly the situation we found ourselves in, and we're glad we dropped in.
Chariot is an old Colombo standard now under new management. The changes seem to be going well. We only tried a rice and curry but the service, location and general feel of the place is good.
name: The Chariot (Dehiwala)

description: Colombo's only proper museum (the Dutch museum and the weird old Town Hall one barely come on par) is pretty amazing. This Italianate colonial style building houses statues, artifacts and paintings that go back as far as the 5th century.
name: Colombo National Museum

description: If you ever need a giant calculator, or something more ordinary like blank CDs or printer cartridges, Unik Creations in Unity Plaza is a decent place. It's not necessarily cheap - a huge calculator costs Rs. 1,500 and blank CDs cost around Rs. 25 each) - but it has basic office supplies you might need.
name: Unik Creations
Spaghetti & Co
description: This Hikkaduwa institution does decent Italian.

Sopranos it seems plays host to a far higher calibre of karaoke than anticipated, and participants seem to take their singing seriously. Certainly there was far less inebriated caterwauling than imagined
name: Sopranos Karaoke

description: The Kingsbury hotel is a massive unmistakable building if you're driving by Galle Face - it's one of the grander ones in the city, with an old Victorian theme (at least with the interior). The views from the hotel, especially from the rooftop bar, are pretty cool. And we thought the hotel deserved points for aesthetics, if the general vibe of extravagance doesn't put you off.
name: The Kingsbury
Indian Chaat Corner
description: Indian Chaat Corner is a tiny barely-noticeable restaurant that specializes in Indian street food. The chaat is still pretty good, and they've got a nicer interior now.

The Dehiwala Zoo is kind of depressing if you're an animal lover, ironically, because a lot of the animals live in sad situations here. Some of the animals have wider greener spaces to live in now though.
name: Dehiwala Zoo

description: The Colombo City Hostel has two brand-new, sparkling clean eight-bed dorms (another is on the way), eight downright posh shower-loo rooms and well thought out public spaces. This might be the best communal accommodation in the city.
address: 177, R. A. De Mel Mawatha, Colombo 03
name: Colombo City Hostel
Dutch Grocer
description: Like any spirited second place finisher of course the proud people at 112, Kirula Road have been hungry for a lamprais rematch.

To any sensible Sri Lankan the mere discovery of good fried rice should be a cause of great joy, but a shop dedicating every single drop of its oil, sweat and ajinomoto to the mixed up manna? Well, we we were excited to say the least.
address: Between Moor's Road and Boswell Place, Marine Drive, Wellawatte
name: Copper Chimney
Dutch Grocer
description: Like any spirited second place finisher of course the proud people at 112, Kirula Road have been hungry for a lamprais rematch.

Gandhara is more a high-end decor empire than a shop. Along with its off shoots and affiliates the store occupies an entire swathe of Stratfrod Avenue. Inside the many-floored, several-roomed emporium you can find everything from antique Chinese cabinets and figurines from South Indian temples to more pedestrian items like candle stick holders and forks.
name: Gandhara

description: Occupying the former Agra bar, Shimmer, the Manchester dons the mantle of the previously Indian themed space, changing pretty much nothing except its name.
name: The Manchester

description: Java Lounge in Jawatta has become our go to spot for casual meetings or we just want to grab a quick coffee. They've got an accessible location, some surprisingly good pasta dishes and coffee that hits the spot more often than not.
name: Java Lounge

description: Colombo's only proper museum (the Dutch museum and the weird old Town Hall one barely come on par) is pretty amazing. This Italianate colonial style building houses statues, artifacts and paintings that go back as far as the 5th century.
name: Colombo National Museum
Nalapaham
description: Nalapaham is for those of you with a sudden mid-day craving for crab - besides the biriyani, idiyapam and kottu, they serve tasty crab, cheap.

While it's not quite as charming as Maradana's second hand strip it's much better laid out and the books seems to be curated- classics at the back, pulp and pop towards the front and a box of more serious contemporary novels on one side.
name: Senanayake Book Shop

description: A couple of years ago the once gentle gathering of music lovers turned into something of a socialite scene, overrun by adolescents ducking for cigarettes behind plastic chairs and the chatter of patrons bubbling over the smooth, sashaying sounds of the sax.
name: Sunday Jazz At CR&FC

description: The Colombo City Hostel has two brand-new, sparkling clean eight-bed dorms (another is on the way), eight downright posh shower-loo rooms and well thought out public spaces. This might be the best communal accommodation in the city.
address: 177, R. A. De Mel Mawatha, Colombo 03
name: Colombo City Hostel

description: To any sensible Sri Lankan the mere discovery of good fried rice should be a cause of great joy, but a shop dedicating every single drop of its oil, sweat and ajinomoto to the mixed up manna? Well, we we were excited to say the least.
address: Between Moor's Road and Boswell Place, Marine Drive, Wellawatte
name: Copper Chimney

description: Machan is something of a godsend if you don’t reside within happy proximity to Colombo’s more central drinking establishments - tukking up to Fort or Colpetty from the lowly ‘burbs can be an expensive, exhaust-filled drag.
name: Machang (Nawala)

description: Panorama is a bar cum restaurant that we don't love as a restaurant, though we have heard good things about the bar. Come here at sunset for the view and don't be too picky about anything else.
name: Panorama (Colombo City Hotel)

description: Gandhara is more a high-end decor empire than a shop. Along with its off shoots and affiliates the store occupies an entire swathe of Stratfrod Avenue. Inside the many-floored, several-roomed emporium you can find everything from antique Chinese cabinets and figurines from South Indian temples to more pedestrian items like candle stick holders and forks.
name: Gandhara

description: Victorias Wines is clearly a posh place to buy your booze. This isn't where we'd go for the weekly Lion run, but if you want to buy a special gift or if you've got some rupee, this is good.
name: Victorias Fine Wines & Spirits

description: Currently closed as it's under renovation.
address: Next to Hotel Nippon, Kumaran Ratnam Road, Colombo 2
name: Dream Land Bar
Cafe Japan
description: Cafe Japan is a small home restaurant off Marine Drive in Colpetty that does some pretty great Japanese cuisine. It's the definition of a hidden gem since the place is ridiculously hard to find. They've been around since 2000, but those who know about the place seem to want to keep it to themselves.
Currently closed as it's under renovation.
address: Next to Hotel Nippon, Kumaran Ratnam Road, Colombo 2
name: Dream Land Bar

description: Bollywood Express is a decent Indian restaurant on Galle Road in Bambalapitiya. While the food isn't quite as tasty as nearby Elite, it's good enough, the place is quiet, and the service is good.
name: Bollywood Express
New Hotel Mayuri
description: The atmosphere of this restaurant may not be inspiring, but the seafood dishes survive the taste test.

A few minutes of browsing in Melache you'll see that local labels are no longer a laughing matter. There are some really lovely pieces in this shop and they are very well priced. Original and handmade creations for as little as Rs 1500.
name: Melaché

description: The Vespa is a fantastic dodgy bar a stones throw from the beach in Kollupitiya. Down Sea View Lane, it's an absurdly large property for what is essentially just a crumbling verandah and an expansive, ill-tended lawn/parking lot.
name: Vespa Sports Club

description: The Full Stop has the highest quality stationery in Colombo, at the highest price. If you want regular paper or a few pens and exercise books, your local stationer or someplace like Sarasavi is a better bet. If, however, you want a long-lasting moleskine or some fancy-glide pens that make you feel more productive for the one-week before you loose them, then Full Stop is the place.
address: L-10 Crescat Boulevard, 75 Galle Road, Colombo 3
name: The Full Stop

description: Sea bathing at Mount Lavinia was an old colonial tradition and for over a century the Mt Lavinia hotel has been the place for an afternoon swim. The swimming pool itself is a modern creation and, well, it’s fine, but not stunning in any way.
address: Mount Lavinia Hotel, Hotel Road, Mount Lavinia
name: Mount Lavinia Hotel (Pool)
New Hotel Mayuri
description: The atmosphere of this restaurant may not be inspiring, but the seafood dishes survive the taste test.

name: Bombay Sweet Centre (Wellawatte)
description: Bombay Sweet Centre does an excellent almond milk (Rs. 150) and beef samosa (Rs. 30). The samosa was the best I've had in the city - full of meat and gleaming green chillis, but not stomach unsettlingly spicy. The piece of muscat was just indulgence.

Well you really can’t do one without the other - Mount Lavinia Hotel and the Galle Face Hotel are Colombo’s colonial duo. So we headed to the GFH’s famed salt water pool. That’s right, no chlorine here, but salt so you get a bit of added buoyancy and less of that horrid chorine smell.
name: Galle Face Hotel (Pool)

description: We liked Sugar Bistro in the past and three years down the line that still hasn't changed. Their food is tasty, they offer a great atmosphere for dining and the service is some of the best you'll experience in Colombo.
address: 89 Galle Road, Crescat Boulevard (adjacent to the Cinnamon Grand Hotel), Kollupitiya
name: Sugar Bistro & Wine Bar
Bombay Sweet Centre (Wellawatte)
description: Bombay Sweet Centre does an excellent almond milk (Rs. 150) and beef samosa (Rs. 30). The samosa was the best I've had in the city - full of meat and gleaming green chillis, but not stomach unsettlingly spicy. The piece of muscat was just indulgence.

name: The Crab Company
address: 54 Haig Road, Colombo 4, facing Marine Drive
description: It was with some delight that I heard tales of the Crab Company - the man behind the king of 90's Colombo restaurant Don Stanelys, now delivering export quality crab to your door. Every crab junkies dream - the stuff you want delivered, by someone reliable.

name: Yarl Eat House
description: The Yarl Eat House is perhaps Sri Lanka's best street-diner, serving spicy crab, prawns, mutton and cuttlefish along with a solid rice and curry, all for a reasonable price.

The Island Coffee shop is so utterly charming and captures perfectly the spirit of a Colombo that is now slipping from the collective memory - an age where nothing was imported and everything had to be local.
name: The Island Coffee Shop
The Floor by O!
description: The Floor By O! has been around for a while now, we've been there before and we find ourselves going back more. With very reasonable prices, competent staff and good music, they seem to know what they're doing.

Of Colombo’s 5 star hotel pools we are partial to the one at Cinnamon Lakeside. It’s probably the most  recently refurbished of the big hotel pools and with its Beira-side views, deep blue tinge, and innovative U-shape it makes for better swimming than your average hotel pool.
address: 115, Sir Chittampalam A. Gardiner Mawatha, Colombo 2
name: Cinnamon Lakeside (Pool)

description: The pink pool at Casa Colombo is less of a pool and more an indulgent pink wallowing hole, though you can manage a few ‘lengths’ at the far end.  It works, though, as Casa is more of a fantasy than a real hotel.
name: Casa Colombo (Pool)

description: At the end of Marine drive its a little fenced off patch of land with seating out doors and a small covered structure for cooking between the train tracks and the sea. There are tables just two feet from the ocean and the food is simple but good and reasonably inexpensive. Prawn fried rice with hot butter cuttle fish and lashings of their chili paste comes to less than Rs. 1000/=.
name: R & R Beach Restaurant
Yaal Restaurant
description: Yaal Restaurant down Marine Drive still serves some very tasty and not-too-pricey food, and their crab curry is still good - though it's their biriyani that blew us away.

name: The Colombo Swimming Club
description: It’s called the swimming club, so this ought to be a good place for a swim - and it is. Apart from splashing it out in the pool, you can also dive into their excellent club-level food.

Rio Ice Cream, a Jaffna franchise that's about forty years old (according to Raja at its Wellawatte branch), is idyllic and affordable for ice cream lovers - they're creative with flavours and mix it up for fun with jelly and smarties, because why not?
name: Rio Ice Cream (Wellawatte)

description: A good drink, bites and lively conversation all tucked away in Colombo 5 – this is really the club for Colombo’s gentlemen of class and distinction.
name: Randoli Sports Club
Malay Restaurant
description: Malay Restaurant in Dehiwala is hugely popular, and after trying our their stuff we can see why. The portions: massive, the flavours: excellent and the prices: reasonable.

While the location of this short eat van isn't all that, it’s not a bad place to stop and have a quick munch in the sunshine. It's clean, the chap that runs it friendly, and the food stands out next to many of the short-eats I've sampled in town.
name: Lauries Lane Short-Eat Van

description: Casa Serena is an affordable arts and handicrafts shop, gallery and bookstore.
name: Casa Serena
Nana's (Galle Face)
description: Nana's is the premier dining venue on Colombo’s premier public space, the Galle Face Green. This tented kade is a favourite for kottu and BBQed seafood.

name: Dunhinda
description: On the Attidiya Road, there’s a small spot that has the best vegetarian food I’ve had in Sri Lanka. Perhaps the best Sri Lankan food. For Rs. 150 you get unlimited rice, kos, pollos, eggplant, potato or whatever they have on offer, plus homemade achcharu, lunuthe and papadum.

In a 90s Colombo rent by the odd suicide bomb and governed by a weak and, above all, careless government, anything went.  More so even than today and the inside of the White Horse on a weekend at 1 am was really the bottled spirit of that era. A time where regulation was non-existant and the party crowd was small but utterly committed - undiluted by mass participation.
name: White Horse (1998-2000)
The Beach Wadiya
description: Beach Wadiya is an old school beachside restaurant in Wellawatte. The service is fast and the food is good, but not excellent.

name: Fortune Boat
description: Fortune Boat was a wonderful find. It's a Chinese restaurant, hidden just off Independence Square near the newly refurbished Colombo Racecourse. You'd never spot it unless you happened to be walking round there.
‘The Takeaway’ is a good alternative to the nearby Sen Saal as their short-eats are almost half the price. They're great: packed with different flavours and about as fresh as they get.
name: 'The Takeaway'

description: Yo-Mo is a small stall on the ground floor of the World Trade Centre selling frozen yoghurt - just that. The place is quite new, opening only about six months ago and their stuff is delicious.
address: World Trade Centre, Echelon Square, Colombo 1
name: Yo-Mo

description: Srina Palace is an unlikely little trove of treasures tucked away in various parts of the city. And it's one of those places, like House of Fashion, that's almost as heavily frequented by Colomboites as it is by locals.
name: Srina Palace

description: The setting is nice and for Rajagiriya, Pelawatte, Battaramulla, Thalwathugoda dwellers looking for some isaraha kema (literally forward food-aka western food) and loathe to leave the hood this is a definitely an option (well it's the only option). The place is definitely well set up for dessert, coffee, wifi and chilling in the burbs.
name: Coco Citrine
New Majestic Hotel
description: The New Majestic Hotel is ironically one of the oldest hotels in Colpetty. How have they been doing since our last visit? Not bad, actually. Not good, but not bad.

name: The Station
description: When it comes to value for money, The Station is pretty difficult to beat. They tick all the right boxes with their ambience, service and food.
Havelock Place Bungalow has got a charming little restaurant with a Barefoot-esque alfresco and good food. The prices aren't too bad, and their home-made ice cream is great.
name: The Havelock Place Bungalow
Heladiv Tea Club (Dutch Hospital)
address: Dutch Hospital Shopping Precinct, Bank of Ceylon Mawatha, Colombo 1
description: The Heladiv Tea Club does a relatively affordable range of tasty waffles, sandwiches and teas at the Dutch Hospital. You can also get a decent bottle of wine here for just Rs. 2000.
පරිගණක ක්‍රීඩා කරමුද? ‍‍කොහුවල හන්දියේ Cafe Vortex එකට යමු!
address: No 10, Sunethra Devi Road, Kohuwala, Nugegoda
name: Cafe Vortex

description: The Galle Face Hotel is one of Colombo's oldest, best known hotels, established in 1864. Over the years it's provided food and shelter to many a revered name: Yuri Gagarin, John D. Rockefeller, Prince Phillip and Richard Nixon, to name just a few. They've changed over the years and we decided to pop in to see how they're doing.
name: The Verandah (Galle Face Hotel)

description: The National Art Gallery essentially consists of two long, rectangular halls - one containing the gallery's permanent collection and the other displaying temporary exhibitions by Sri Lankan artists. It's an interesting place with some very interesting works, but it's not really what you'd expect from a national gallery.
address: 106 Ananda Coomaraswamy Mawatha, Cinnamon Gardens, Colombo 7
name: The National Art Gallery

description: In the most unlikely place- a row of shabby kades on the turn off just before the Rowing Club, is the most magical little shop. Hewage’s Jewellers is the sort of shop you find in novels; a dark and slightly dusty treasure trove filled in this case quite literally with treasure. Ancient chests, cabinets, and cupboards crammed with gem-studded Kandyan hairpins, intricately worked bracelets, and heavy, opulent silver chains.
address: 49/2 Sri Chittampalam A. Gardiner Mawatha, Colombo 2
name: Hewage & Sons Jewelers
Yarl Eat House
description: The Yarl Eat House is perhaps Sri Lanka's best street-diner, serving spicy crab, prawns, mutton and cuttlefish along with a solid rice and curry, all for a reasonable price.

name: Arabian Knights
description: After an initial hiccup, Arabian Knights has bounced back well. The food is nearly back to their former glory, and coupled with the new venue, things are looking up again.

As the name suggests, a good place for generous burgers. Generous means that the burgers are big and have good cuts of meat, including lamb. The vegetarian burger here is also quite respectable. It's a big, fat mushroom and quite satisfying even for carnivores.
name: Burger Blast
Mythi's
description: Mythi's is a small streetside restaurant on Fife Road that offers arguably the best black pork curry in Colombo, along with a killer rice and curry.

The National Art Gallery essentially consists of two long, rectangular halls - one containing the gallery's permanent collection and the other displaying temporary exhibitions by Sri Lankan artists. It's an interesting place with some very interesting works, but it's not really what you'd expect from a national gallery.
address: 106 Ananda Coomaraswamy Mawatha, Cinnamon Gardens, Colombo 7
name: The National Art Gallery
Mathura Restaurant
description: Mathura is a decent Indian vegetarian restaurant that has been around Colombo for years, but now at a new location.
Hansa Coffee is a great place for original Hansa coffee and chocolate, and brownies. It's an affordable, cosy coffee lounge.
name: Hansa Coffee
Flower Drum
description: Good ambience, decent food, over-rated chili paste. Okay value for groups.
A good drink, bites and lively conversation all tucked away in Colombo 5 – this is really the club for Colombo’s gentlemen of class and distinction.
name: Randoli Sports Club
Ministry Of Crab (Dutch Hospital)
description: Ministry of Crab is a high-end restaurant on Dutch Hospital premises that specializes in crab cuisine - the food is just plain mouth-watering and the service is good.
Hansa Coffee is a great place for original Hansa coffee and chocolate, and brownies. It's an affordable, cosy coffee lounge.
name: Hansa Coffee

description: If your goal is to communicate how much money or status you have, this probably isn't the place, but if you're just trying to give a thoughtful gift of flowers, you can't go wrong with plucking your own bouquet down Dean's Road.
name: Silani Flora
Bombay Sweet Mahal (Wellawatte)
description: Bombay Sweet Mahal is one of many shops selling Indian sweets and fruit juice in Wellawatte. What sets it apart are their special offerings, like the multi-layered fruit cocktail (Rs. 290) and the seasonal durian juice.

name: Mythi's
description: Mythi's is a small streetside restaurant on Fife Road that offers arguably the best black pork curry in Colombo, along with a killer rice and curry.

name: Ministry Of Crab (Dutch Hospital)
description: Ministry of Crab is a high-end restaurant on Dutch Hospital premises that specializes in crab cuisine - the food is just plain mouth-watering and the service is good.
At Rs 260, the Ex-Serviceman's Institute Bar (open to all) is as cheap as beer gets. Its all male clientele is actually quite well-mannered.
name: Ex-Servicemen's Institute Bar

description: A whole grilled fish, a pile of garlic drenched prawns, some ice cold bottles of lion larger, the roar of the sea all to yourself on a weekday evening. This is what Haus Chandra/the Boat Haus Cafe offers.
name: Boat Haus Cafe (Haus Chandra)

description: If your goal is to communicate how much money or status you have, this probably isn't the place, but if you're just trying to give a thoughtful gift of flowers, you can't go wrong with plucking your own bouquet down Dean's Road.
name: Silani Flora
China Doll (Delivery)
description: China Doll runs a reliable and good delivery service. It's not your usual Chinese (no MSG for example) but it's creative, tasty and original.

While the location of this short eat van isn't all that, it’s not a bad place to stop and have a quick munch in the sunshine. It's clean, the chap that runs it friendly, and the food stands out next to many of the short-eats I've sampled in town.
name: Lauries Lane Short-Eat Van

description: Happy Banana is one of the better known joints in Una, often used as both landmark and collection point - if you find yourself lost, just tell someone to meet you by Happy Banana. You'll be fine.
name: Happy Banana

description: Independence Square is still a great place to relax in Colombo. It's part monument, part park, part walking ground. It's main function seems to be as the place where Colombars go for their evening constitutional (walk).
name: Independence Square

description: The Boardwalk is our favourite new place for a drink. It's located in a beautiful open area by the Diyawanna Lake, in Battaramulla, You drink under the stars while watching cute little ducks chase each other by the water.
name: The Boardwalk

description: Video International is the gold (or blue) standard for DVDs in Colombo. They have a good selection of foreign films in high quality, including Blu-Ray.
name: Video International

description: The Coffee Bean is a pretty comfortable place to relax at, though the bill can make you rather uncomfortable.
name: The Coffee Bean & Tea Leaf

description: This tiny memorial to Sri Wickrama Rajasingha in the Ceylinco parking lot is a quirky destination.
name: The Last King's Jail Cell

description: Lanka Hands is a great place to buy gifts and souvenirs from. It may not be quite as classy as Barefoot or Paradise Road, or have it's own trademark range, but it sells plenty of nice Sri Lankan craft items and at a better price than its competitors.
name: Lanka Hands

description: While Rize doesn't blow you away with it's concept or theme, it is blissfully non-douchey compared to many other nightclubs. You can wear rubber slippers and nobody's likely to smash your head into the bar while asking 'do you know who my father is?'
name: Rize

description: Independence Square is still a great place to relax in Colombo. It's part monument, part park, part walking ground. It's main function seems to be as the place where Colombars go for their evening constitutional (walk).
name: Independence Square

description: Video International is the gold (or blue) standard for DVDs in Colombo. They have a good selection of foreign films in high quality, including Blu-Ray.
name: Video International

description: We liked Sugar Bistro in the past and three years down the line that still hasn't changed. Their food is tasty, they offer a great atmosphere for dining and the service is some of the best you'll experience in Colombo.
address: 89 Galle Road, Crescat Boulevard (adjacent to the Cinnamon Grand Hotel), Kollupitiya
name: Sugar Bistro & Wine Bar
168 Sea Food Palace
description: 168 Sea Food Palace is a veteran among Chinese eateries in Colombo and is still hugely popular among locals. They do a decent take on Sri Lankan Chinese with efficient, but the place looks quite run down now.
Some of the food at Steamboat is good, but the delivery service and website are a bit of a shambles.
name: Steam Boat (Nawala)

description: What does the inside of an Internet business look like? If you visit the office of BuyOnline.lk you can see. BuyOnline is a decent looking website that sells tablets, computers, cameras, etc.
address: 1 Deanstone Place, off Galle Road, Colombo 3
name: BuyOnline.lk

description: Lanka Hands is a great place to buy gifts and souvenirs from. It may not be quite as classy as Barefoot or Paradise Road, or have it's own trademark range, but it sells plenty of nice Sri Lankan craft items and at a better price than its competitors.
name: Lanka Hands

description: Bollywood Express is a decent Indian restaurant on Galle Road in Bambalapitiya. While the food isn't quite as tasty as nearby Elite, it's good enough, the place is quiet, and the service is good.
name: Bollywood Express

description: The Vespa is a fantastic dodgy bar a stones throw from the beach in Kollupitiya. Down Sea View Lane, it's an absurdly large property for what is essentially just a crumbling verandah and an expansive, ill-tended lawn/parking lot.
name: Vespa Sports Club

description: Some of the food at Steamboat is good, but the delivery service and website are a bit of a shambles.
name: Steam Boat (Nawala)
The Crab Company
address: 54 Haig Road, Colombo 4, facing Marine Drive
description: It was with some delight that I heard tales of the Crab Company - the man behind the king of 90's Colombo restaurant Don Stanelys, now delivering export quality crab to your door. Every crab junkies dream - the stuff you want delivered, by someone reliable.

name: Cafe Japan
description: Cafe Japan is a small home restaurant off Marine Drive in Colpetty that does some pretty great Japanese cuisine. It's the definition of a hidden gem since the place is ridiculously hard to find. They've been around since 2000, but those who know about the place seem to want to keep it to themselves.

name: Juiceez
description: Juiceez is pretty good. The staff are quite sweet and obliging, and their fruit is fresh and generally high quality. The menu when compared to Roots, however, is limited. They just do juices, straight up. No mixes, smoothies or health drinks.

The Tree of Art, an almost unnoticeable little store selling a random collection of Barefoot/Paradise Road type items - ie. incense holders, candles, boxes, brass pots, etc. It's a sweet place with exceptionally friendly and helpful staff.
name: The Tree Of Art

description: The ice cream was pretty tasty. Creamy not overly synthetic- the fig flavour had the satisfying stickiness of real dried figs and while the cookies and cream didn’t taste exactly like a cookie it was a good ice-creamy impersonation.
address: No.2, R.A. De Mel Mawatha, Colombo 5
name: Baskin Robbins

description: Anusha Handicrafts, outside Kollupitiya Market by Liberty Junction, is an odd place and something of an overwhelming experience, crammed as it is from floor to ceiling with teetering piles of assorted hand-carved wooden curios.
name: Anusha Handicrafts
Shanmugas
description: Shanmugas is one of the older and more reputed vegetarian Indian restaurants. They're definitely pricier than most places but the food is very good and the service is excellent.

name: Sen Saal
description: Sen Saal is another one of Colombo's quick eat places. LikeFab, they serve short eats, cakes, dessert and lamprais. Sen Saal is also a good example of the Sri Lankan love of making things more difficult than they need to be - ordering and paying is a complicated, painful process here.

The Lover is a hugely popular local shop, selling an abundance of plastic and shiny jewelled goods. Earrings, bracelets, rings, phone bling, handbags, shoes...you name it. And they have over 50 branches across the country. Unlike Srina Palace which is a bright tangle of hair product, gems and jewellery, the Lover is often more orderly and better laid out.
name: The Lover (Nugegoda)
Hotel Amirthaa
description: Amirthaa is a cheap, clean, pure-veg South Indian restaurant in Bambalapitiya. The place gets pretty hectic, but the food is good.

name: Elite Indian Restaurant
description: Elite Indian Restaurant offers a wide range of savory veg and non-veg Indian dishes as well as an array of sweets.

While the food at Forty Forty (a low-key lunchtime rice and curry spot tucked down a tiny alley opposite Unity Plaza on Galle Road) isn't much to write home about, the setting gives the restaurant a run-down charm.
address: Galle Road (land-side), opposite Bambalapitiya Station Road, Colombo 4
name: Forty Forty Foods
Sugarland
description: Sugarland is a tiny little bakery in Havelock Town, located behind The Souq.  They sell some very nice cupcakes. These don't come in many flavours - mainly just vanilla and chocolate - but they're all quite good. Simple and sweet, and with some pretty toppings.

We've been looking forward to the opening of the refurbished Racecourse Grounds in Cinnamon Gardens. The old Dutch Hospital in Fort was renovated by the same authorities recently and they pretty much got it spot on, turning it into a lovely courtyard encircled by good restaurants and shops. Since the derelict Race Course was being done up under the same peeps, we expected it to turn out like Dutch Hos - ie. awesome.
address: Race Course Ground, Reid Avenue, Colombo 7
name: The Colombo Racecourse

description: A rice and curry buffet with with 20 curry options, some of the best views in the city and a super central location for Rs. 1000? Well that's what Akasa Kade on the top floor of the Ceylinco House building in Fort offers every day of the week.
address: Ceylinco House, 13th Floor, 69 Janadhipathi Mawatha, Colombo 1
name: Akasa Kade
Elite Indian Restaurant
description: Elite Indian Restaurant offers a wide range of savory veg and non-veg Indian dishes as well as an array of sweets.

name: Coconut At Cantaloupe Aqua
description: I can understand the appeal of Aqua to a certain clientele. It's probably a good place for a party. The beach isn't always swimmable, but there's a nice area where you can drinks some cocktails, watch the waves or even lounge in the plunge pool without getting your hair wet. And they play some decent music. But it's certainly not worth travelling too far out of your way for in terms of food.

name: Shanmugas
description: Shanmugas is one of the older and more reputed vegetarian Indian restaurants. They're definitely pricier than most places but the food is very good and the service is excellent.

We've been looking forward to the opening of the refurbished Racecourse Grounds in Cinnamon Gardens. The old Dutch Hospital in Fort was renovated by the same authorities recently and they pretty much got it spot on, turning it into a lovely courtyard encircled by good restaurants and shops. Since the derelict Race Course was being done up under the same peeps, we expected it to turn out like Dutch Hos - ie. awesome.
address: Race Course Ground, Reid Avenue, Colombo 7
name: The Colombo Racecourse

description: Whether you're just visiting Colombo or you live here, the Cinnamon Grand Brunch is a must visit. This lavish Sunday luncheon has long been a tradition with many Colombo families who, after church or a Sunday lie in, drive over to spend their afternoon ensconced in the Taprobane restaurant amidst cascading chocolate fountains, silver platters of oysters and glistening legs of lamb.
address: Cinnamon Grand, Shri Uttarananda Road, Colombo
name: Cinnamon Grand Brunch

description: This tiny memorial to Sri Wickrama Rajasingha in the Ceylinco parking lot is a quirky destination.
name: The Last King's Jail Cell

description: Ramani’s is a nice place and a good salon. It won't give you for money, but they're reliable and probably won’t ruin your hair. The staff – at the Nugegoda branch at least – are lovely. They haven’t changed in years, they remember all their clients and they’re just really, really sweet and friendly.
name: Ramani Fernando Salon

description: The park is perched above the Mount Lavinia Hotel and the ocean. It's a serene public space where you can hear and smell the sea but still be surrounded by green. They have a huge lawn, ample playground equipment, a full basketball court and even a small lending library.
name: Mount Lavinia Children's Park

description: So another day in our quest for a restaurant (not a hole in the wall/buth kadai) that serves a good rice and curry meal. We had a hot tip on The Angler a small restaurant down Hotel Road just up the road from the Mt Lavinia Hotel. We heard they served up a good homestyle curry with an emphasis on seafood, so expecting delicious piles of squid and prawn curry we rushed down to everyone’s favorite beachside suburb.
name: The Angler

description: The Lover is a hugely popular local shop, selling an abundance of plastic and shiny jewelled goods. Earrings, bracelets, rings, phone bling, handbags, shoes...you name it. And they have over 50 branches across the country. Unlike Srina Palace which is a bright tangle of hair product, gems and jewellery, the Lover is often more orderly and better laid out.
name: The Lover (Nugegoda)

description: A rice and curry buffet with with 20 curry options, some of the best views in the city and a super central location for Rs. 1000? Well that's what Akasa Kade on the top floor of the Ceylinco House building in Fort offers every day of the week.
address: Ceylinco House, 13th Floor, 69 Janadhipathi Mawatha, Colombo 1
name: Akasa Kade

description: La Passion is a midrange, established hair salon
name: La Passion

description: This is a confused place. It's barely got anything to do with chocolate.
name: Choco Luv

description: A gang of hairdressers operating out of three small rooms on Vajira Road, with a branch in Mount Lavinia.
name: Sleek Salon
Chinese Dragon Cafe
description: One of the oldest Chinese restaurants in Colombo, Chinese Dragon does an okay job.

The park is perched above the Mount Lavinia Hotel and the ocean. It's a serene public space where you can hear and smell the sea but still be surrounded by green. They have a huge lawn, ample playground equipment, a full basketball court and even a small lending library.
name: Mount Lavinia Children's Park

description: So another day in our quest for a restaurant (not a hole in the wall/buth kadai) that serves a good rice and curry meal. We had a hot tip on The Angler a small restaurant down Hotel Road just up the road from the Mt Lavinia Hotel. We heard they served up a good homestyle curry with an emphasis on seafood, so expecting delicious piles of squid and prawn curry we rushed down to everyone’s favorite beachside suburb.
name: The Angler
Rama's Tea House (RIP)
description: Closed now. Rama's Tea House is a new... something in Battaramulla, near the Kotte Road turn-off. I saw something because it's a weird and not entirely satisfying mix of tea house and English pub.

name: Thai Cuisine La Rambla
description: La Rambla is a pleasant little restaurant tucked away down Hotel Road in Mount Lavinia. If you're looking for a quiet, private meal with good food and quick service, this is one we'd recommend. They now exclusively serve up Thai food under the same name and roof.

name: Siam House
description: Siam House serves up reliable and tasty Thai-fare, and they're built for volume and deliveries.

name: Thai Cuisine La Rambla
description: La Rambla is a pleasant little restaurant tucked away down Hotel Road in Mount Lavinia. If you're looking for a quiet, private meal with good food and quick service, this is one we'd recommend. They now exclusively serve up Thai food under the same name and roof.
As far as safe bets go, Bayleaf is right up there. Good Italian fare at not too exorbitant prices, and a rather extensive menu to choose from.
name: The Bayleaf
The Beach Wadiya
description: Beach Wadiya is an old school beachside restaurant in Wellawatte. The service is fast and the food is good, but not excellent.
As far as safe bets go, Bayleaf is right up there. Good Italian fare at not too exorbitant prices, and a rather extensive menu to choose from.
name: The Bayleaf
Harbour Room (Grand Oriental Hotel)
description: One of the best views anywhere in the city or the region, in an incredibly under-rated colonial property.

name: Dinemore
description: Dinemore's never struck me as an exceptional place. I've always enjoyed the food and found it tasty, but it's not the kind of place I'd actively choose to go to – it was more of an oh it's just round the corner or grab a quick bite sort of place.
Harbour Stop is a hidden gem - a 24 hour food joint in a beautiful, historical Fort building.
name: Harbour Stop
Tasty Caterers
description: Tasty Caterers is one of the better bakeries in Colombo. They've got a good range of savouries, and some of the best eclairs in the city.

name: Harpo's Pizza
description: Harpo's is known for their premium pizzas. The delivery though was an arduous process and took way longer than we expected.
This is a sorta wall monument to... the truth. We think. This is a plaque in Borella which reads:The Foundation Of The Truth: The objective of the foundation is to establish irrefutable knowledge.
name: The Foundation Of The Truth

description: The Cargills Food City on Staple Street is one of the city's best supermarkets. It was the chain's first outlet, and has been around since 1983. It's large and offers a wider variety of products than most other stores. No promises, but you can probably satisfy most of your culinary requirements here.
name: Cargills Food City - Staple Street

description: If you're ever at the Borella junction (Baseline and Cotta Road) you'll see the stairs leading down. These steps lead pedestrians under and across the road and have, over time, became home to a fair amount of shops. Here you can get everything from cell phones to 'fancy gift items'. Actually, that's about it.
name: The Borella Underpass
Heladiv Tea Club (Dutch Hospital)
address: Dutch Hospital Shopping Precinct, Bank of Ceylon Mawatha, Colombo 1
description: The Heladiv Tea Club does a relatively affordable range of tasty waffles, sandwiches and teas at the Dutch Hospital. You can also get a decent bottle of wine here for just Rs. 2000.

name: Park Street Mews Restaurant
description: Park Street Mews Restaurant is one of those select few that have managed to remain relevant and maintain high standards throughout the years. They haven't changed much at all, but we're fine with that since the food is excellent, the service is fast and the unorthodox setting is still quite chic.
Havelock Place Bungalow has got a charming little restaurant with a Barefoot-esque alfresco and good food. The prices aren't too bad, and their home-made ice cream is great.
name: The Havelock Place Bungalow
The Cricket Club Cafe
description: The old classic at a brand new spot.

name: Sits
description: Sits has been our favourite cake baker for a while. Her chocolate and red velvet cupcakes are some of the best in town.
Once you get there (following our tips), the experience is awesome. Not to be missed. Nothing beats a tense Sri Lanka cricket game, and the show is good even when Sri Lanka isn't playing.
name: R. Premadasa Stadium
Arabian Knights
description: After an initial hiccup, Arabian Knights has bounced back well. The food is nearly back to their former glory, and coupled with the new venue, things are looking up again.

There's a farm in the Bandaranaika Memorial International Conference Hall grounds. I know that sounds odd as the BMICH is the nation's principal conference center and located in the center of Colombo, so not really what you'd think of an as agricultural spot, but nevertheless someone has installed rows of fruit trees, vegetable plots and even a cattle shed with a few cows in it.
name: BMICH Model Farm
Arabian Knights
description: After an initial hiccup, Arabian Knights has bounced back well. The food is nearly back to their former glory, and coupled with the new venue, things are looking up again.

name: Chesa Swiss
address: 3 Deal Place A, Colombo 3, Sri Lanka
description: Sadness, this place is closed

name: Sen Saal
description: Sen Saal is another one of Colombo's quick eat places. LikeFab, they serve short eats, cakes, dessert and lamprais. Sen Saal is also a good example of the Sri Lankan love of making things more difficult than they need to be - ordering and paying is a complicated, painful process here.
I often really want to go to Roots. Because it's hot, and occasionally they give you a really good smoothie. But more often you just get a warm drink and crappy service.
name: Roots

description: If you're ever at the Borella junction (Baseline and Cotta Road) you'll see the stairs leading down. These steps lead pedestrians under and across the road and have, over time, became home to a fair amount of shops. Here you can get everything from cell phones to 'fancy gift items'. Actually, that's about it.
name: The Borella Underpass

description: If you're ever at the Borella junction (Baseline and Cotta Road) you'll see the stairs leading down.
