These steps lead pedestrians under and across the road and have, over time, became home to a fair amount of shops. Here you can get everything from cell phones to 'fancy gift items'. Actually, that's about it.
name: The Borella Underpass
Nihonbashi (ODEL)
description: Nihonbashi is one of our most famous restaurants - they serve the best sushi in the city, fact. This is the place for Japanese fine cuisine.

name: Suki's Wok
description: Suki's Wok is one of the oldies when it comes to Chinese eateries in Colombo. Nowadays they're mostly into delivery, so we tried it, and they're okay.

name: Sits
description: Sits has been our favourite cake baker for a while. Her chocolate and red velvet cupcakes are some of the best in town.

The Nelum Pokuna Art Street is Colombo's only or at least oldest 'street art' space: a long pavement stretch of paintings by local artists, opposite Viharamahadevi Park, frequented by art enthusiasts and tourists.
name: Nelum Pokuna Art Street

description: The National Art Gallery essentially consists of two long, rectangular halls - one containing the gallery's permanent collection and the other displaying temporary exhibitions by Sri Lankan artists. It's an interesting place with some very interesting works, but it's not really what you'd expect from a national gallery.
address: 106 Ananda Coomaraswamy Mawatha, Cinnamon Gardens, Colombo 7
name: The National Art Gallery

description: This is one of the more upmarket eating establishments on Vauxhall. It looks clean and professional: tiled and terrazzo floors, glass windows and an extensive, clearly printed menu on the wall. You can order from the menu but most of the food is already prepared: mounds of fried rice, plain samba rice, biriyani, nasi goreng, curries, veg.
name: Millennium Restaurant

description: This place does a decentish bath packet for around Rs. 170. Samba rice, dahl, a couple of vegetables curries (gotakola, beetroot, snake-gourd, etc) and sometimes soya, wrapped up with your choice of chicken or fish
name: New Pillawoos on Kew Road
Dinemore
description: Dinemore's never struck me as an exceptional place. I've always enjoyed the food and found it tasty, but it's not the kind of place I'd actively choose to go to – it was more of an oh it's just round the corner or grab a quick bite sort of place.

Rio Ice Cream, a Jaffna franchise that's about forty years old (according to Raja at its Wellawatte branch), is idyllic and affordable for ice cream lovers - they're creative with flavours and mix it up for fun with jelly and smarties, because why not?
name: Rio Ice Cream (Wellawatte)
Harpo's Pizza
description: Harpo's is known for their premium pizzas. The delivery though was an arduous process and took way longer than we expected.

If you want to sit in a comfortable environment and wait an hour to get something printed, Softwave Gallery is the place. If you're missing the sarcasm, this is not the place to go, ever. Softwave are good printers, but their Gallery is an abomination.
name: Softwave Gallery
Hazari's
description: Hazari's has managed to maintain their Middle-Eastern standard while moving to their new Marine Drive location.

name: Aviraté Café
description: Tiny little cafe with excellent froyo and plenty sandwiches, juices, smoothies, coffee and tea. Roast paan is on point.

name: Healthy Cafe
description: Near the mosque on Bauddhaloka Mawatha near Bambalapitiya Junction is my contender for the bath kade that sells one of the best budget lunch packets in Colombo 4 (what the hell, maybe even the whole city!).
Anim8 is an expensive but fast print shop. It's a really bare bones operation carved out of a residential house on Thimbirigasaya Road.
name: Anim8
Han Gook Gwan
description: Han Gook Gwan does a authentic take on Korean cuisine at a reasonable price. You'll most likely be walking away with a new found love for Korean cuisine.

name: Tasty Caterers
description: Tasty Caterers is one of the better bakeries in Colombo. They've got a good range of savouries, and some of the best eclairs in the city.

A whole grilled fish, a pile of garlic drenched prawns, some ice cold bottles of lion larger, the roar of the sea all to yourself on a weekday evening. This is what Haus Chandra/the Boat Haus Cafe offers.
name: Boat Haus Cafe (Haus Chandra)

description: The New Colonial Hotel is at the high end of dodgy bars. Downstairs is a high-ceilinged bar with bad food but decent drinks and a nice ambiance.
name: New Colonial Hotel

description: We’re not huge fans of the French macaron, but they looked so pretty that we gave Munchkin a call and ordered ourselves a box of 10, which included an assortment of vanilla, chocolate and pistachio flavours.
name: Munchkin

description: The setting is nice and for Rajagiriya, Pelawatte, Battaramulla, Thalwathugoda dwellers looking for some isaraha kema (literally forward food-aka western food) and loathe to leave the hood this is a definitely an option (well it's the only option). The place is definitely well set up for dessert, coffee, wifi and chilling in the burbs.
name: Coco Citrine

description: Yo-Mo is a small stall on the ground floor of the World Trade Centre selling frozen yoghurt - just that. The place is quite new, opening only about six months ago and their stuff is delicious.
address: World Trade Centre, Echelon Square, Colombo 1
name: Yo-Mo

description: This place does a decentish bath packet for around Rs. 170. Samba rice, dahl, a couple of vegetables curries (gotakola, beetroot, snake-gourd, etc) and sometimes soya, wrapped up with your choice of chicken or fish
name: New Pillawoos on Kew Road
Dutch Burgher Union Bar
description: This is one of Colombo's real hidden gems so do make the time for a visit. Evenings are best and though the upstairs is for members only you can either recruit a member friend or just wander up and hope the bar staff are sufficiently desperate for something to do that they serve you anyway (this often happens).

For those with no prior knowledge of Chinese they offer beginners classes - Saturdays 11.30- 1 PM, Rs 6000 for six months. Judging by the standard of the intermediate class this is probably the most accessible and best value introduction to Chinese available in Colombo.
name: Confucius Institute: Chinese Classes

description: You can get a decent used PC (with monitor) with 3 month warranty for about Rs. 22,000, or about half the price of a new one.
name: AOne Computers

description: The Brewery by O!, or O bar as it's more commonly referred to, is insanely popular. Go there any night of the week, even Sunday, and it's likely to be full to the brim with beer brandishing patrons.
name: The Brewery By O!
New Majestic Hotel
description: The New Majestic Hotel is ironically one of the oldest hotels in Colpetty. How have they been doing since our last visit? Not bad, actually. Not good, but not bad.
This is without a shadow of a doubt Colombo's best Japanese bakery. It is also Colombo's only Japanese bakery.  In absolute bakery terms this is a good place to go for cakes and general sweetness.
name: Patisserie Esmerelda

description: There's a farm in the Bandaranaika Memorial International Conference Hall grounds. I know that sounds odd as the BMICH is the nation's principal conference center and located in the center of Colombo, so not really what you'd think of an as agricultural spot, but nevertheless someone has installed rows of fruit trees, vegetable plots and even a cattle shed with a few cows in it.
name: BMICH Model Farm
Dinemore
description: Dinemore's never struck me as an exceptional place. I've always enjoyed the food and found it tasty, but it's not the kind of place I'd actively choose to go to – it was more of an oh it's just round the corner or grab a quick bite sort of place.
So where do you go to buy affordable cashew? Well, cashew isn't ever going to be cheap. But apparently the Sri Lanka Cashew Corporation (SLCC) sells them at subsidised rates.
name: Sri Lanka Cashew Corporation
Park Street Mews Restaurant
description: Park Street Mews Restaurant is one of those select few that have managed to remain relevant and maintain high standards throughout the years. They haven't changed much at all, but we're fine with that since the food is excellent, the service is fast and the unorthodox setting is still quite chic.

name: The Fab
description: Ah, Fab. It's been around longer than we can remember - since 1979 to be precise - and has consistently been keeping Colombo happy with their short eats, cakes and sweets.

name: Royal Thai (Cinnamon Lakeside)
address: Cinnamon Lakeside, 115 Sir Chittampalam A. Gardiner Mawatha, Colombo 2
description: Royal Thai is a great celebratory option. With delicious food and impeccable service, it's definitely one of Colombo's reigning dining royalty.

We've had quite a few new ice cream parlors pop up over the past few years (no complaints from us!), but Il Gelato still reigns supreme when it comes to high quality ice cream. There's just this small issue of having to empty your wallet for a few scoops..
name: Il Gelato

description: The New Colonial Hotel is at the high end of dodgy bars. Downstairs is a high-ceilinged bar with bad food but decent drinks and a nice ambiance.
name: New Colonial Hotel
The Commons Coffee House
description: Commons is one of Colombo's most popular hangout spots. They've got a great location on flower road and a relaxed atmosphere. Its expansive menu means your spoilt for choice but quality varies depending on what you choose.

name: China Doll (Delivery)
description: China Doll runs a reliable and good delivery service. It's not your usual Chinese (no MSG for example) but it's creative, tasty and original.

For those with no prior knowledge of Chinese they offer beginners classes - Saturdays 11.30- 1 PM, Rs 6000 for six months. Judging by the standard of the intermediate class this is probably the most accessible and best value introduction to Chinese available in Colombo.
name: Confucius Institute: Chinese Classes

description: For those with no prior knowledge of Chinese they offer beginners classes - Saturdays 11.30- 1 PM, Rs 6000 for six months. Judging by the standard of the intermediate class this is probably the most accessible and best value introduction to Chinese available in Colombo.
name: Confucius Institute: Chinese Classes
Harpo's Pizza
description: Harpo's is known for their premium pizzas. The delivery though was an arduous process and took way longer than we expected.

name: Bavarian German Restaurant
description: The Bavarian has been around for ages, and is still hugely popular. Change can be a good thing but sometimes when you're doing something right, you should stick to it, and that's exactly what the German Restaurant has done.

The park is perched above the Mount Lavinia Hotel and the ocean. It's a serene public space where you can hear and smell the sea but still be surrounded by green. They have a huge lawn, ample playground equipment, a full basketball court and even a small lending library.
name: Mount Lavinia Children's Park

description: The Brewery by O!, or O bar as it's more commonly referred to, is insanely popular. Go there any night of the week, even Sunday, and it's likely to be full to the brim with beer brandishing patrons.
name: The Brewery By O!

description: Sweet Wishes by Vish is a veteran among Colombo homebakers. Her bakes have survived the test of time and her new stuff and savouries taste delicious.
name: Sweet Wishes by Vish

description: The Bloom Room is a high-end florist on Ward Place. It's one of those places where you give them your budget and they select a matching amount of flowers, but it's of good quality and with competent service and responsive management.
name: Bloom Room
The Fab
description: Ah, Fab. It's been around longer than we can remember - since 1979 to be precise - and has consistently been keeping Colombo happy with their short eats, cakes and sweets.

There's a farm in the Bandaranaika Memorial International Conference Hall grounds. I know that sounds odd as the BMICH is the nation's principal conference center and located in the center of Colombo, so not really what you'd think of an as agricultural spot, but nevertheless someone has installed rows of fruit trees, vegetable plots and even a cattle shed with a few cows in it.
name: BMICH Model Farm
McDonald's (Nugegoda)
description: Indi and Shru have been making an effort to convince me of the merits of Mc Rice. I’ve responded with stubborn scepticism.  I don’t eat McDonalds (it’s not food snobbery, or maybe it is) but I’ll eat anything from the grimmest vaddai on the train to Trinco, to the offaly offerings served behind the butchers at Malay street.

name: Healthy Cafe
description: Near the mosque on Bauddhaloka Mawatha near Bambalapitiya Junction is my contender for the bath kade that sells one of the best budget lunch packets in Colombo 4 (what the hell, maybe even the whole city!).

name: Nana's (Galle Face)
description: Nana's is the premier dining venue on Colombo’s premier public space, the Galle Face Green. This tented kade is a favourite for kottu and BBQed seafood.

name: Dutch Burgher Union Bar
description: This is one of Colombo's real hidden gems so do make the time for a visit. Evenings are best and though the upstairs is for members only you can either recruit a member friend or just wander up and hope the bar staff are sufficiently desperate for something to do that they serve you anyway (this often happens).

name: Bombay Sweet House (Kollupitiya)
description: Sadly closed, after years. Bombay Sweet House is the original Sri Lankan candy shop, the city's oldest candy makers, and still remains the best place for Indian sweets and a fresh glass of Faluda.

This is one of the more upmarket eating establishments on Vauxhall. It looks clean and professional: tiled and terrazzo floors, glass windows and an extensive, clearly printed menu on the wall. You can order from the menu but most of the food is already prepared: mounds of fried rice, plain samba rice, biriyani, nasi goreng, curries, veg.
name: Millennium Restaurant
The Gallery Café
description: The Gallery Cafe is one of those perpetually hip spots in Colombo. The ambience is one of a kind and the  food is consistently good, but it will leave a dent in your wallet.

Rio Ice Cream, a Jaffna franchise that's about forty years old (according to Raja at its Wellawatte branch), is idyllic and affordable for ice cream lovers - they're creative with flavours and mix it up for fun with jelly and smarties, because why not?
name: Rio Ice Cream (Wellawatte)
Hazari's
description: Hazari's has managed to maintain their Middle-Eastern standard while moving to their new Marine Drive location.

name: Harbour Room (Grand Oriental Hotel)
description: One of the best views anywhere in the city or the region, in an incredibly under-rated colonial property.

name: Bombay Sweet House (Kollupitiya)
description: Sadly closed, after years. Bombay Sweet House is the original Sri Lankan candy shop, the city's oldest candy makers, and still remains the best place for Indian sweets and a fresh glass of Faluda.

name: Bombay Sweet Mahal (Wellawatte)
description: Bombay Sweet Mahal is one of many shops selling Indian sweets and fruit juice in Wellawatte. What sets it apart are their special offerings, like the multi-layered fruit cocktail (Rs. 290) and the seasonal durian juice.
Harbour Stop is a hidden gem - a 24 hour food joint in a beautiful, historical Fort building.
name: Harbour Stop
Rama's Tea House (RIP)
description: Closed now. Rama's Tea House is a new... something in Battaramulla, near the Kotte Road turn-off. I saw something because it's a weird and not entirely satisfying mix of tea house and English pub.

name: Mathura Restaurant
description: Mathura is a decent Indian vegetarian restaurant that has been around Colombo for years, but now at a new location.

If you've ever wondered what's in that long-ass ugly block of a building opposite next to Liberty Cinema - this post is going to take you through it - here you'll find handcrafts, travel agencies, a shipping surveyor, a whole floor of vegetables, another full of butchers, shops that sell colourful buckets and mops, grocery stores, Chinese grocery stores - and then unexpectedly - rare and awesome food products imported from Italy, Australia and the UAE.
address: 65 Srimath Anagarika Dharmapala Mawatha, Colombo 3, Sri Lanka
name: Kollupitiya Market

description: A whole grilled fish, a pile of garlic drenched prawns, some ice cold bottles of lion larger, the roar of the sea all to yourself on a weekday evening. This is what Haus Chandra/the Boat Haus Cafe offers.
name: Boat Haus Cafe (Haus Chandra)

description: St Andrews has actually always been something of another world. This was the planter’s church built by homesick Scottish tea-planters in 1842 and traditionally the congregation was predominantly European. Its attractive simplicity makes it a real contender for most beautiful church in Colombo.
name: St. Andrew's Scots Kirk

description: St Andrews has actually always been something of another world. This was the planter’s church built by homesick Scottish tea-planters in 1842 and traditionally the congregation was predominantly European. Its attractive simplicity makes it a real contender for most beautiful church in Colombo.
name: St. Andrew's Scots Kirk

description: If you've ever wondered what's in that long-ass ugly block of a building opposite next to Liberty Cinema - this post is going to take you through it - here you'll find handcrafts, travel agencies, a shipping surveyor, a whole floor of vegetables, another full of butchers, shops that sell colourful buckets and mops, grocery stores, Chinese grocery stores - and then unexpectedly - rare and awesome food products imported from Italy, Australia and the UAE.
address: 65 Srimath Anagarika Dharmapala Mawatha, Colombo 3, Sri Lanka
name: Kollupitiya Market
Heaven's Kitchen
description: Heaven's Kitchen, which apparently used to be called Hell's Kitchen, is a small but obviously successful bath kade in Rajagiriya, just past the junction down the Borella-Rajagiriya road where it snakes towards Buthgamuwa Road and the Fairmount/Fairway apartments. They have an excellent pork curry.

name: The Gallery Café
description: The Gallery Cafe is one of those perpetually hip spots in Colombo. The ambience is one of a kind and the  food is consistently good, but it will leave a dent in your wallet.

name: Bombay Sweet House (Kollupitiya)
description: Sadly closed, after years. Bombay Sweet House is the original Sri Lankan candy shop, the city's oldest candy makers, and still remains the best place for Indian sweets and a fresh glass of Faluda.

name: Hazari's
description: Hazari's has managed to maintain their Middle-Eastern standard while moving to their new Marine Drive location.

name: Heaven's Kitchen
description: Heaven's Kitchen, which apparently used to be called Hell's Kitchen, is a small but obviously successful bath kade in Rajagiriya, just past the junction down the Borella-Rajagiriya road where it snakes towards Buthgamuwa Road and the Fairmount/Fairway apartments. They have an excellent pork curry.
At Rs 260, the Ex-Serviceman's Institute Bar (open to all) is as cheap as beer gets. Its all male clientele is actually quite well-mannered.
name: Ex-Servicemen's Institute Bar

description: It’s June and rambutan-season is just kicking off – those of us who are fans can be seen flocking the pavement of Havelock Road near the BRC Grounds, asking the aiyyas to stuff plastic bags with red and green fruit.
name: Havelock Road Fruit Market
Chinese Dragon Cafe
description: One of the oldest Chinese restaurants in Colombo, Chinese Dragon does an okay job.

name: Siam House
description: Siam House serves up reliable and tasty Thai-fare, and they're built for volume and deliveries.

name: The Beach Wadiya
description: Beach Wadiya is an old school beachside restaurant in Wellawatte. The service is fast and the food is good, but not excellent.
Casa is a building as art, but better even than its nifty finishes is the fact that it’s WELL PRICED.
name: CASA Colombo

description: Casa Serena is an affordable arts and handicrafts shop, gallery and bookstore.
name: Casa Serena

description: Harbour Stop is a hidden gem - a 24 hour food joint in a beautiful, historical Fort building.
name: Harbour Stop

description: La Passion is a midrange, established hair salon
name: La Passion

description: A gang of hairdressers operating out of three small rooms on Vajira Road, with a branch in Mount Lavinia.
name: Sleek Salon
Rama's Tea House (RIP)
description: Closed now. Rama's Tea House is a new... something in Battaramulla, near the Kotte Road turn-off. I saw something because it's a weird and not entirely satisfying mix of tea house and English pub.

name: Nana's (Galle Face)
description: Nana's is the premier dining venue on Colombo’s premier public space, the Galle Face Green. This tented kade is a favourite for kottu and BBQed seafood.
Colombo Courtyard is a business hotel which also serves as one of the city's hippest new bars.
name: Colombo Courtyard

description: Foster & Reed is the island's go to company for all things swimming pool related, or 'water related recreational facilities' as their website says. Involved in all aspects of poolware from construction and maintenance to spas, saunas and steam cabins, they're pretty much the top supplier of pools around the country.
name: Foster & Reed
Deepika Kodikara (Home Baker)
description: Best brownies ever.
Hana Mart, while small, sells a good selection of fun Korean food. Shrimp crackers, ramen, kimchi, biscuits and so on.
name: Hana Mart
Bars Cafe
description: Bars Cafe has gotten a facelift, along with a revamped menu. They've definitely got room for improvement, but we were happy to see that they had addressed some of their old issues.

What is magic corn? We're not sure where the magic part comes in, but it's basically a little snack made from steamed kernels of sweetcorn mixed together with a variety of spices, salt, pepper, cheese, garlic, etc. depending on the flavour you ask for.
address: Majestic City, Galle Road, Bambalapitiya, Colombo 4
name: Magic Corn

description: In Negombo, where you have less ice creamy options (although an Il Gelato is opening up soon), Rio stands as a pleasure dome filled with cool, brightly coloured confections.
name: Rio Ice Cream (Negombo)
Naniyori
description: Naniyori is good value for money.  Decent dine-in at Nawala and best sushi delivery in Colombo.
In Negombo, where you have less ice creamy options (although an Il Gelato is opening up soon), Rio stands as a pleasure dome filled with cool, brightly coloured confections.
name: Rio Ice Cream (Negombo)

description: Sweet Tomato Halal Family Restaurant is a decent if slightly expensive option in Pettah, across from the Red Mosque. Down 2nd Cross Street, this clean and friendly establishment serves a decent biriyani at the rather high price of Rs. 400. They also do fried rice and rice and curry.
name: Sweet Tomato
Gonuts With Donuts
address: Dudley Senanayake Mawatha, Colombo 00800, Sri Lanka
description: When Gonuts with Donuts started off they were all the craze. Now many years down the line, the hype has died down, their prices have gone up, but they're still pretty decent.
Located in Uppuveli, near the third milepost, lies Isha Water Park (also known as ‘Waves’). An entrance fee of 600/ buys you a day at this perpetually deserted waterpark.
name: Isha Water Park (Uppuveli)

description: Serving the best handallo in town, the GSSC is a dodgy bar with cheap drinks and decent patrons.
name: Government Service Sports Club
Kouchi
description: I’m confident that Kouchi is the best Japanese restaurant in Battaramula. While it’s not worth the journey if you live in Colombo – if you’re based in the area, it’s not a bad mid-range option.

Water World is South Asia’s first underwater tunnel aquarium and is the only public aquarium in Sri Lanka. Despite the name, the attraction is actually a combination of two parks, the aquarium and a bird park.
name: Water World & Bird Park (Kelaniya)

description: Roughly 10 kilometres from the centre of Colombo, the Kelaniya Temple is one of the most well known Buddhist temples in the Colombo area and, in my opinion, one of the most beautiful in Sri Lanka. Built on the banks of the Kelani River, (which flows from Sri Pada/Adam's Peak), the temple is said to be particularly sacred, as the Buddha visited the site on his third visit to Sri Lanka.
name: Kelaniya Raja Maha Vihara (Kelaniya Temple)

description: The Barnesbury is another cafe in Colombo. They've got a lovely garden out back, interesting London themed decor and they do an ordinary range of generic Western dishes.
name: The Barnesbury

description: SaBaBa's is basically the only place on Whiskey Point. It's run by Mambo's brother and is pretty chill. It's underground (no website/Facebook/etc), but if you show up they'll serve you.
address: Whiskey Point, Arugam Bay, Eastern Province
name: SaBaBa's

description: The Weerawila Lake is located along the A2, the Galle Road, but well past Galle and Hambantota, as the road begins to head up to the hills. It's notable because the road cuts right through the lake, giving you stunning views and a quite pleasant drive.
name: Weerawila Lake

description: I was pleasantly surprised to find all sorts of trinkets here - think ‘The Lover’s’ more subdued and sensible cousin. It’s a small store but everything’s well organized and the place is usually deserted.
name: 5th Avenue

description: Hideaway is the best restaurant and probably the best hotel in Arugam Bay. It has excellent food and accommodation and thoughtful family management.
name: Hideaway Villas

description: Happiness is a well done and comprehensive kids shopping site backed by a company which has good stock and delivers it fast. If you're a busy parent or gift-giver, this is an excellent alternative to the sweating it out on the streets.
name: Happiness.lk

description: Whiskey Point is a quite surfable and moderately swimmable point about 12 km from Arugam Bay. It's a bit of a trek, but worth it for some great waves and the chill cafe/hotel SaBaBa's.
address: Whiskey Point, Arugam Bay, Eastern Province
name: Whiskey Point
LeeSH
description: A charming little sandwich bar owned by the loveliest couple with delicious food.

name: La Trattoria
description: La Trattoria is an Italian restaurant in Battaramulla replacing Coco Citrine. It's very expensive, but the food is decent.

name: Shiraz
description: Shiraz is a great new restaurant on Stratford Avenue serving Iranian cuisine upon the old upper floors of Gandhara. At the moment they're only open for dinner, which is served buffet style and costs around Rs. 1500 per head for copious portions of meat, rice and mezze

name: La Trattoria
description: La Trattoria is an Italian restaurant in Battaramulla replacing Coco Citrine. It's very expensive, but the food is decent.

Big Bite in Mount Lavinia is one of the few places where you can get yourself a proper Pakistani biriyani. It's spicier than most, but it's still damn good, specially coupled with their barbequed chicken.
name: Big Bite (Mount Lavinia)

description: There's a lovely new aquarium at Diyatha Uyana, the site of the Good Market, near Water's Edge. Each tank is run by a different fish store. It's not Sea World, but it's still a worthwhile stroll in a circle.
name: Diyatha Uyana Aquarium (Battaramulla)

description: The Savoy Restaurant is a pretty good dodgy bar, situated just above the Savoy Cinema. It's a big space and in a relatively non-dodgy neighborhood, but with the same dodgy bar drink and food prices.
name: Savoy Restaurant (Bar)

description: The Savoy Restaurant is a pretty good dodgy bar, situated just above the Savoy Cinema. It's a big space and in a relatively non-dodgy neighborhood, but with the same dodgy bar drink and food prices.
name: Savoy Restaurant (Bar)

description: Meh. If you want not-fast fast food, Dinemore (which also has a branch on Marine Drive) is a more reliable option. While Redberry's has a good location, the food is mediocre.
name: Redberry's

description: Whiskey Point is a quite surfable and moderately swimmable point about 12 km from Arugam Bay. It's a bit of a trek, but worth it for some great waves and the chill cafe/hotel SaBaBa's.
address: Whiskey Point, Arugam Bay, Eastern Province
name: Whiskey Point
Coffee Stop (Cinnamon Grand)
description: Coffee Stop at the Cinnamon Grand serves high quality short-eats, sandwiches, cakes and confectionary. It's open til 2 AM every day.
Main Point is the most accessible surf spot in Arugam Bay and it has something for surfers, swimmers and loungers alike.
name: Main Point (Arugam Bay)

description: The ‘rukada’ figures have been handcrafted by traditional puppet artists with remarkable attention to detail.
name: Traditional Puppet Art Museum

description: Hideaway is the best restaurant and probably the best hotel in Arugam Bay. It has excellent food and accommodation and thoughtful family management.
name: Hideaway Villas

description: Big Bite in Mount Lavinia is one of the few places where you can get yourself a proper Pakistani biriyani. It's spicier than most, but it's still damn good, specially coupled with their barbequed chicken.
name: Big Bite (Mount Lavinia)

description: Completed in 1924, the oldest and longest iron bridge in Sri Lanka now lies unused next to a new bridge that opened this year in March. The Kallady Bridge is also known for being an ideal location to hear the famed singing fish of Batticaloa.
name: Kallady / Lady Manning Bridge (Batticaloa)

description: Ivory Inn is a mid sized bed and breakfast, located in Mount Lavinia. They have clean and comfortable rooms starting at around Rs. 3500.
name: Ivory Inn

description: If you're traveling in packs, Villa Red is a far better value than the package hotels in Bentota. You have full access to the river and watersports and have a really well-equipped villa to hang out in.
name: Villa Red

description: We liked Sugar Bistro in the past and three years down the line that still hasn't changed. Their food is tasty, they offer a great atmosphere for dining and the service is some of the best you'll experience in Colombo.
address: 89 Galle Road, Crescat Boulevard (adjacent to the Cinnamon Grand Hotel), Kollupitiya
name: Sugar Bistro & Wine Bar

description: A small road takes you to the beautiful beach at Kallady, which carries sombre reminders of the tragedy that struck Sri Lanka in 2004. Debris that the Boxing Day Tsunami left behind are now cordoned off by short picket fences with signs warning visitors to conduct themselves respectfully on the beach.
name: Kallady Beach (Batticaloa)

description: Palm Beach Hotel is located in Mount Lavinia, it has the feel of a modern Sri Lankan hotel with rooms starting from about Rs. 7200.
name: Palm Beach Hotel
Chesa Swiss
address: 3 Deal Place A, Colombo 3, Sri Lanka
description: Sadness, this place is closed
Hotel Alakamanda is a great place to relax after a day exploring the Sacred City of Anuradhapura. The hotel offers a little bit of luxury and excellent service, but it comes at a price.
name: Hotel Alakamanda (Anuradhapura)

description: Home Basics is a relatively unfrequented lifestyle store located at the Tisara Plaza in Kohuwela. There’s a substantial variety of linen, kitchenware, bathware and  tableware. Most items appear to be sourced from all over South Asia.
address: 3rd Floor, Tisara Plaza, Dutugemunu Street, Kohuwela
name: Home Basics

description: Gecko is a restaurant/hotel located on the highly popular main strip of Arugam Bay. They have a great seafront location with chilled out seating and good food, but the service is terrible.
name: Gecko

description: The Central Cultural Fund’s website is down and tickets to Sigirya, Polonaruwa and Anuradhapura must be purchased from one of their offices. Their head office is located at Bauddhaloka Mawatha but I prefer the branch at Thambiah avenue as it has a bookstore/souvenir shop.
name: Central Cultural Fund
Tsing Tao (Colombo Racecourse)
address: Race Course Promenade, Reid Avenue, Colombo 7
description: Tsing Tao is a fine dinning Chinese restaurant that strikes a good a balance between authentic and Sri Lankanized Chinese, in a chic and elegant setting.

Kapruka’s global shop connects you to all the giant US merchants like Amazon, eBay, Wal-Mart, Best Buy, and others. They take a 5% commission for having it shipped down to Sri Lanka and mailed to your door. Of course you still have to pay for the shipping and clearance from Customs. What Kapruka offers is an easy and convenient way to shop online.
name: Kapruka Global Shop
Butter Boutique
description: Butter Boutique has moved now! They're officially setting up shop at Rosmead Place so we went to check them out.

name: Java Lounge (Cotton Collection)
description: Java Lounge is a nice little coffee shop attached to Cotton Collection on Dharmapala Mawatha. It's not cheap (no coffee shop is) but it's roomy, has parking and they take care with their drinks.

name: Tsing Tao (Colombo Racecourse)
address: Race Course Promenade, Reid Avenue, Colombo 7
description: Tsing Tao is a fine dinning Chinese restaurant that strikes a good a balance between authentic and Sri Lankanized Chinese, in a chic and elegant setting.

name: Udumbara JU Caterers
description: JU Caterers is an awesome rice & curry place - they combine tasteful ambience with bath kade prices.

name: Yue Chuan (Kingsbury)
description: Yue Chuan is a fine dining Chinese restaurant located at the Kingsbury hotel. The food is good, but not excellent.
Hustler's Paintball is a bit out there but it offers a great paintball experience with expert guidance, good gear and a built in river bath afterwards.
name: Hustler's Paintball (Hanwella)

description: Saraii Village is a charming set of tree-houses and mud chalets near Hambantota. They also make an excellent rice and curry. Probably the best place to stay in the area.
address: Randunu Kele Watte, Weerawila, Hambantota District
name: Saraii Village (Weerawila)

description: Meh. If you want not-fast fast food, Dinemore (which also has a branch on Marine Drive) is a more reliable option. While Redberry's has a good location, the food is mediocre.
name: Redberry's
Yue Chuan (Kingsbury)
description: Yue Chuan is a fine dining Chinese restaurant located at the Kingsbury hotel. The food is good, but not excellent.
Hustler's Paintball is a bit out there but it offers a great paintball experience with expert guidance, good gear and a built in river bath afterwards.
name: Hustler's Paintball (Hanwella)
Butter Boutique
description: Butter Boutique has moved now! They're officially setting up shop at Rosmead Place so we went to check them out.
Saraii Village is a charming set of tree-houses and mud chalets near Hambantota. They also make an excellent rice and curry. Probably the best place to stay in the area.
address: Randunu Kele Watte, Weerawila, Hambantota District
name: Saraii Village (Weerawila)

description: There's a lovely new aquarium at Diyatha Uyana, the site of the Good Market, near Water's Edge. Each tank is run by a different fish store. It's not Sea World, but it's still a worthwhile stroll in a circle.
name: Diyatha Uyana Aquarium (Battaramulla)

description: Adam's Bridge, which separates the Gulf of Mannar from the Palk Strait, is a string of sand islands, that once connected Talaimannar to Rameswaram Island in India.
name: Adam's Bridge Boat Tours
Ace Pub
description: Ace Pub is a great rooftop bar located above the Steam Boat/Naniyori restaurant building in Nawala. It's got a lovely view of the city at night and they serve reasonably priced drinks, inoffensive sushi and decent Chinese

name: AYU thé
description: AYU thé (Ayu branded tea) makes tasty bespoke blends of tea (strawberry, ginger honey, etc). They're available at the Good Market on Thursdays or by delivery. Good either hot or cold.

name: Summer Garden
description: Summer Garden on Green Path is a popular watering hole among men. It's not much for ambience, but they do some affordable, hearty meat dishes.

The lifestyle gym is a part of the SLTA building (Sri Lanka Tennis Association) and has been one of Colombo’s ancient and more popular gyms for more than two decades. It also happens to be one of the smallest gyms in Colombo, but over the years Lifestyle has evolved from a gym to a comprehensive centre for fitness and health.
address: Sir Marcus Fernando Mawatha, Colombo 07, Sri Lanka
name: Lifestyle Gym

description: The Body Bar gym sits down Jawatte Avenue (Jawatte Road) in Colombo 7. It seems to be quite quite popular with folks in Colombo - it's clean and there's a sense of homeliness that you look for in a gym. The trainers speak pretty good English and were really helpful when I asked for a tour of the place.
name: Body Bar Gym

description: Quickee.lk has gained a lot of popularity over the past year as an online delivery option, and they now deliver from a bunch of new places.
name: Quickee.lk
Korean Barbecue KBQ
description: KBQ in Rajagiriya does fried chicken and noodles, with a Korean twist.

name: Acropol
description: Acropol Restaurant which formerly resided on R.A De Mel Mawatha has moved to a new location on Galle Road, Colombo 03. If you're a fan of shawarmas it's worth a visit.

name: Barista Lavazza (Horton Place)
description: One of Colombo's first coffee shops, but no longer one of the best.

name: Maharaja Palace
description: Maharaja Palace is one of the few fine dining Indian restaurants in Colombo. The prices are high but the portions are actually quite large now. Their food was always pretty good and it seems they've made some necessary improvements.
Fitness First sits on top of the HSBC bank and the Reebok showroom opposite Avirate Cafe. Located in convenient Colombo 7, it’s a fitness spa with a gym, swimming pool, Jacuzzi and sauna
name: Fitness First Gym

description: The Vege Way is one of the latest additions to the clustered stalls of wholesome foods, beverages and knick knacks that is the Good Market.
name: The Vege Way

description: Sizzle is an experience restaurant with a great selection of meats and even decent vegetarian. Everything is served sizzling, even the drinks.
name: The Sizzle
China Doll
description: China Doll, once a fresh entry into the Chinese Restaurant tamasha is no longer the jaw dropping experience it once was.

The Royal College Gym is found in the Royal College Sports Complex, home to Royal ruggerites and sportsmen alike. The complex comprises of the famous rugby field (this is where the Bradby takes place), an indoor basketball court, badminton courts, volleyball court, squash courts, a netball court, a boxing ring and of course - the Royal Gym.
name: Royal College Gym

description: Quickee.lk has gained a lot of popularity over the past year as an online delivery option, and they now deliver from a bunch of new places.
name: Quickee.lk

description: CLOSED: Speed Drome in Battaramulla, as far as I know, is the only place for pro karting in close proximity to Colombo. They used to have a smaller circuit in Excel World (AKA Millenium Park before)  but it looks like they’ve sold their go karts for scrap metal leaving Speed Drome the only place for an injection of speed.
address: 260/1, Pannipitiya Road, Pelawatta, Battaramulla, Sri Lanka.
name: Speedrome
Spicy Cabin
description: We heard good things about Spicy Cabin, but our experience simply wasn't that good.
Taphouse is the replacement for the beloved Brewery By O! in Dutch Hospital. Everything is basically worse than it used to be but it's still a great location.
name: Taphouse By RnR (Dutch Hospital)
Red Fort Restaurant
description: Red Fort Restaurant is a small North Indian Restaurant on a small side road just off Baseline Road. The restaurant looks like an old abandoned house with wild grass and a kid’s playground at the front. The place is quite small but the service here is good and all in all, it’s a quaint, comfy place to have a meal.
Adam's Bridge, which separates the Gulf of Mannar from the Palk Strait, is a string of sand islands, that once connected Talaimannar to Rameswaram Island in India.
name: Adam's Bridge Boat Tours
AYU thé
description: AYU thé (Ayu branded tea) makes tasty bespoke blends of tea (strawberry, ginger honey, etc). They're available at the Good Market on Thursdays or by delivery. Good either hot or cold.

Bankhill Wellness Studio is located in the Olympic House right next to Independence Square. This hidden house of weights sits on top of Fortune Boat and it happens to be the cheapest and grimiest gym we’ve reviewed yet.
address: Olympic House, No. 100/9F, Independence Avenue, Colombo 7
name: Bankhill Wellness | Olympic House Mini Studio

description: NLDB (National Livestock Development Board) has two, shall we say bigger, parlors selling milk related products.
name: NLDB Milk Parlor

description: NLDB (National Livestock Development Board) has two, shall we say bigger, parlors selling milk related products.
name: NLDB Milk Parlor

description: Casa is a building as art, but better even than its nifty finishes is the fact that it’s WELL PRICED.
name: CASA Colombo

description: Waters Edge is a splash of paradise in Colombo’s Concrete Jungle - located in Battaramulla, it’s a rich oasis with much lush greenery and some breathtaking views of the Diyawanna Lake.
name: Waters Edge Gym

description: Bargain/ second hand bookshop
name: Sarasavi Warehouse
Eatrite
description: EatRite, a part of Susiko Bakers, is working to promote (healthier) rice flour products - which includes local delicacies like milk toffees and kawung.

name: Dilmah t-Lounge
description: Dilmah's charming tea lounge in the shadow of Dutch Hospital is still going strong, with a range of hot and cold teas and little and large bites.

name: Mama Aida's Catering
description: Mama Aida's is good home cooked Middle Eastern food, but also rather expensive, and only really makes sense for groups of more than six.
La Fiesta is Sri Lanka's first Mexican (well, Tex-Mex) restaurant, located on Chatham Street in the old fertiliser building (now, of course, refurbished).
name: La Fiesta
Dilmah t-Lounge
description: Dilmah's charming tea lounge in the shadow of Dutch Hospital is still going strong, with a range of hot and cold teas and little and large bites.

The Pottery Shop is a warm, cramped space full of clayware precariously balanced on tired looking shelves. All  items are handmade by local craftsmen. They have lamps, ornaments, teapots, plates, mugs, pendants, shampoo containers for hotels and spas, fragrant oils, ashtrays; the works.
name: The Pottery Shop

description: High Octane Fitness is found in Pamankada, pretty close to The Dutch Burger and Shiraz on Stratford Avenue. It is the best gym in Sri Lanka, need I say more?
name: High Octane Fitness Gym

description: La Fiesta is Sri Lanka's first Mexican (well, Tex-Mex) restaurant, located on Chatham Street in the old fertiliser building (now, of course, refurbished).
name: La Fiesta
Red Fort Restaurant
description: Red Fort Restaurant is a small North Indian Restaurant on a small side road just off Baseline Road. The restaurant looks like an old abandoned house with wild grass and a kid’s playground at the front. The place is quite small but the service here is good and all in all, it’s a quaint, comfy place to have a meal.

name: Sarasavi Warehouse

name: Waters Edge Gym
Tea Breeze
description: Worth a visit for the location alone, but the menu is uninspiring.

name: Body Bar Gym

name: Bankhill Wellness | Olympic House Mini Studio
Mlesna Tea Centre
description: We all know Mlesna, the go-to tea brand for gifting someone overseas or impressing a visitor. The sheer variety is also impressive - with over 100 kinds of tea, you are bound to enjoy at least one.

name: Tea Breeze
description: Worth a visit for the location alone, but the menu is uninspiring.

name: Mlesna Tea Centre
description: We all know Mlesna, the go-to tea brand for gifting someone overseas or impressing a visitor. The sheer variety is also impressive - with over 100 kinds of tea, you are bound to enjoy at least one.

name: Loon Tao
description: Loon Tao, roughly meaning "Way of the Dragon" has lost its claim as a top contender in the Chinese restaurant racket.
Compared to newer entrants Delifrance is overpriced and underwhelming, but they still do reliably tasty sandwiches and baked goods.
name: Delifrance (ODEL)

description: Charming place for a beer along the coast, but not best for bites.
name: Daniel's Pub (Ahungalla)

description: The ‘rukada’ figures have been handcrafted by traditional puppet artists with remarkable attention to detail.
name: Traditional Puppet Art Museum
Loon Tao
description: Loon Tao, roughly meaning "Way of the Dragon" has lost its claim as a top contender in the Chinese restaurant racket.

Unlike their flagship store at Alexandra Place, this outlet is not a tourist hotspot and you don't have to queue up for a vacant changing room because it is rarely (if ever) crowded.
The products at Kohuwala are slightly more affordable for the average shopper. You can buy a summer dress for around Rs 2500.
name: Odel (Kohuwela)

description: The store’s fluorescent lighting, white walls, white shelves and white floor tiles render the space rather clinical and cold.  I found it eerily reminiscent of Oregon State Hospital (The setting of ‘One Who Flew Over the Cuckoo’s Nest’ ). But don’t let that put you off because the grim interior is redeemed by great customer service, and it is rarely crowded.  They also have parking space, which is small but adequate.
address: 99, S De S Jayasinghe Mawatha, Nugegoda
name: Vijitha Yapa Bookshop (Nugegoda)

description: Pasco Food Blush is a new eatery that has recently come up on Pannipitiya road in Battaramulla. It’s only a few meters away from where Coco Citrine used to be (they’ve been replaced by La Trattoria – a fancy new Italian restaurant). If you’re driving past Food Blush in the night, it’s pretty hard to miss - there’s a bright neon sign and a big screen out in the courtyard facing the road.
name: Pasco Food Blush

description: Ignore the colossal white concrete box that is the Laksala outlet , and keep walking/driving towards the right, and you will find the serene Craft Village. Inspired by the Indian handicraft village ‘Dilli Haat’, the Shilpa Village is a sizeable estate comprising of several workshops housed in clay huts.
address: Folk Art Complex (Janakala Kendraya), Pelawatta, Battaramulla, Sri Lanka
name: Shilpa Craft Village

description: A short walk on the ramparts is a must to enjoy the spectacular view of the Batticaloa Lagoon and the few Dutch-era cannons that remain.
name: Batticaloa Fort

description: If you really like chocolate it's worth a try, but this Indian franchises drinks, sweets and frozen yogurt just aren't that good.
name: Chocolate Room
Glassé
description: Currently closed and replaced.
Interesting place. Food wasn't mind-blowing but it was good and we'll definitely give the other menu items a try. What really sets it apart is the staff, who really seem to put love into the food.
name: Hippie Chippie
The Manhattan Fish Market
description: The Manhattan Fish Market has delicious seafood and ridiculously friendly stuff - it's an awesome place to dine at if you can handle the bill.

name: The Lagoon (Cinnamon Grand)
description: The Lagoon is a fine dining seafood restaurant located in Colombo's Cinnamon Grand Hotel. Freshly caught seafood is displayed upon a bed of ice and can be chosen with the preferred style of preparation and sides. It's very good, and very expensive.

name: Kinnaree
description: The menu features more than just Thai food. Lunch deals include stroganof and caeser salad. Decent value, good ambience.
Curve, at Park Street Mews, is a tapas bar that's been around for a couple of years. While the purple-white theme is looking a bit old now, their tapas and drinks are still pretty good.
name: Curve

description: Swyree is a little spot near Orr's Hill which serves a great Kottu and fried frice. East coast kottu is different and this place is worth a try.
name: Swyree

description: Getting quality gifts is often too hard in Colombo. If you're willing to spend more than Rs. 2,000, Lexon makes gifting design a lot easier and more fun.
name: Lexon Gift Depot
Java Lounge (Cotton Collection)
description: Java Lounge is a nice little coffee shop attached to Cotton Collection on Dharmapala Mawatha. It's not cheap (no coffee shop is) but it's roomy, has parking and they take care with their drinks.

OSMO Fitness in Battaramulla is an all round sports centre, in progress. They have a pretty great gym here, and tennis, badminton and squash courts. A 50m swimming pool is said to be on its way, but I think this might take at least another year to finish.
name: OSMO Fitness

description: CLOSED. La Voile Blanche is a chic all-white beachside restaurant in Mount Lavinia. The service is friendly and the food is pretty good, albeit a bit expensive.
name: La Voile Blanche (RIP)
Min Han
description: Min Han (or Ming Han) is one of our favorite Chinese restaurants. It's cheap, super tasty and the waiter Wijapayala orders for you.
With promos all week, you can get a good deal on biriyani and nasi goreng.
name: Spice & Ice (Omega Regency Hotel)

description: Anything.lk now delivers fruits and vegetables online. Excellent quality, almost excellent service. And you only pay Rs. 150 for delivery - a small amount considering the amount of hassle and time saved.
name: Anything.lk Vegetable Delivery

description: CLOSED: Speed Drome in Battaramulla, as far as I know, is the only place for pro karting in close proximity to Colombo. They used to have a smaller circuit in Excel World (AKA Millenium Park before)  but it looks like they’ve sold their go karts for scrap metal leaving Speed Drome the only place for an injection of speed.
address: 260/1, Pannipitiya Road, Pelawatta, Battaramulla, Sri Lanka.
name: Speedrome
Rizwan's Wade Cart (Trinco)
description: On the corner of Dockyard's and St. Mary's (depending) Rizwan runs a good wade cart. He's got manioc chips, fried garlic, and those little wade balls. He's a nice guy, the food is fresh and just different enough from Colombo stuff to be interesting.

name: The Cakery
description: The Cakery used to be a resident favourite amongst the plebs at office, but they've long since dwindled in terms of service and food.

If you're traveling in packs, Villa Red is a far better value than the package hotels in Bentota. You have full access to the river and watersports and have a really well-equipped villa to hang out in.
name: Villa Red

description: Curve, at Park Street Mews, is a tapas bar that's been around for a couple of years. While the purple-white theme is looking a bit old now, their tapas and drinks are still pretty good.
name: Curve

description: Interesting place. Food wasn't mind-blowing but it was good and we'll definitely give the other menu items a try. What really sets it apart is the staff, who really seem to put love into the food.
name: Hippie Chippie

description: Anything.lk now delivers fruits and vegetables online. Excellent quality, almost excellent service. And you only pay Rs. 150 for delivery - a small amount considering the amount of hassle and time saved.
name: Anything.lk Vegetable Delivery
Rizwan's Wade Cart (Trinco)
description: On the corner of Dockyard's and St. Mary's (depending) Rizwan runs a good wade cart. He's got manioc chips, fried garlic, and those little wade balls. He's a nice guy, the food is fresh and just different enough from Colombo stuff to be interesting.

name: Panino
description: Panino makes excellent sandwiches. Filled with tasty ingredients, grilled, prepared with love. If you visit the Good Market each Thursday they're well worth a try. Otherwise they're a good choice for catering or office lunches.

name: Warehouse Project
description: This stall serves a variety of stuff - from nai miris to pollos cutlets to dim sum. It's all very good.

name: Warehouse Project
description: This stall serves a variety of stuff - from nai miris to pollos cutlets to dim sum. It's all very good.

name: Pigeon Island Beach Resort
description: If you want to get away from the more crowded Nilaveli Beach Resort and have a decent, affordable meal, Pigeon Island Beach Resort is a good spot. It had a great owner (RIP) and continues to have good, hospitable staff.

name: Adma Agro
description: Adma Agro in Nuwara Eliya is well known for their fresh strawberries and strawberry products. The store itself isn't in the best shape, but thankfully their desserts are still pretty tasty.
Sweetberry is a small juice bar which specializes in berries (strawberries, raspberries, blackberries, blueberries, etc).
name: Sweetberry

description: Swyree is a little spot near Orr's Hill which serves a great Kottu and fried frice. East coast kottu is different and this place is worth a try.
name: Swyree
Raja Bojun
address: Liberty Arcade, 282, R. A. De Mel Mawatha, Colombo 03
description: Raja Bojun is generally known for good Sri Lankan cuisine. They've moved from their old spot near Galle Face to a new location at the top of Liberty Arcade. The food is still good, so is the spread, though nothing amazing. We loved the seafood best.

name: Panino
description: Panino makes excellent sandwiches. Filled with tasty ingredients, grilled, prepared with love. If you visit the Good Market each Thursday they're well worth a try. Otherwise they're a good choice for catering or office lunches.

This shop is a miniature version of the bigger  Laksala which is just a 10 minute walk from here. The vibrant souvenir boutique holds some small wooden carvings, decorated brass ornaments, some handloom clothing, gems and jewellery and some handy little painted bowls.
name: Laksala – Colombo Racecourse
Pigeon Island Beach Resort
description: If you want to get away from the more crowded Nilaveli Beach Resort and have a decent, affordable meal, Pigeon Island Beach Resort is a good spot. It had a great owner (RIP) and continues to have good, hospitable staff.

name: Dinemore (Kohuwala)
description: Sri Lanka’s favourite submarine is probably that at Dinemore. This fast food franchise has been around for quite a while, and by the looks of it they’ve expanded and opened up many more restaurants in Colombo, Kandy and even expanding internationally by branching out into the beautiful islands of the Maldives.
Sweetberry is a small juice bar which specializes in berries (strawberries, raspberries, blackberries, blueberries, etc).
name: Sweetberry

description: Expect to drop a small fortune of you plan on purchasing some Barefoot apparel. But as the old adage goes “You pay for what you get.” and what you get is very special. There are stories of people who still have their first Barefoot sarong from 30+ years ago and live in Iceland. The far dynasty that this brand has created is staggering.
name: Barefoot (Galle Road)
Golden Mile
description: There are a slew of restaurants on Mt Lavinia Beach, and the Golden Mile, in my mind offers a sense of sea-faring adventure that you won’t find anywhere else on the strip. The whole place is all rustic and salty appearing as if an ancient ship had run aground. You make your way up to the top dining area and seat yourself on the “first deck” where you can relax and take it all in while sipping a Lion Lager.

name: The Manhattan Fish Market
description: The Manhattan Fish Market has delicious seafood and ridiculously friendly stuff - it's an awesome place to dine at if you can handle the bill.

name: Mount Burger
description: As Colombo’s culinary landscape evolves at warp speed, burger fans have been among its most fortunate diners, with cheap, high quality purveyors of the fast-food classic emerging with the frequency and doggedness of mosquitoes during the monsoon. Mount Burger, located a stone’s throw from Mt. Lavinia’s Beach Road, is one of the city’s newest contenders, but it has a way to go before it can jostle with Colombo’s burger big boys.
The Vege Way is one of the latest additions to the clustered stalls of wholesome foods, beverages and knick knacks that is the Good Market.
name: The Vege Way

description: Plant your feet in the sand and watch the waves roll in as the traffic of Mt Lavinia Beach frolic by. Apart from this initial attraction the rest of our experience was somewhat forgettable.
name: The Lavinia Breeze Mount Lavinia
Ace Pub
description: Ace Pub is a great rooftop bar located above the Steam Boat/Naniyori restaurant building in Nawala. It's got a lovely view of the city at night and they serve reasonably priced drinks, inoffensive sushi and decent Chinese

name: The Manhattan Fish Market
description: The Manhattan Fish Market has delicious seafood and ridiculously friendly stuff - it's an awesome place to dine at if you can handle the bill.

name: Chatz
description: Chatz is a newly opened little café in Horton place. They have a crazy range of things to eat - from lamb chops and grilled prawns to mutton kotthu and buriyani (asian) to nachos and fajitas (Mexican). They also do some salads, soups, burgers and pizza; no shortage for choice really.

This is a cute little store sitting right above Coco Veranda and Buddhi Batiks on Ward Place. It’s filled with brightly coloured beach shorts and slippers from Arugam Bay. They also have a pretty funky collection of men’s shirts, some lovely evening dresses and long flowy ‘hippy pants’ for those summer beach parties.
name: Stringhopper | Conscience
Diyawanna Food Court
description: The Diyawanna Food Court, located in Alcatraz, is a recent development with some of the big names of the fast food culinary scene. The place is essentially just a big car park and probably the best place for kids to ride their bike or try on their roller blades. These days it’s also become inhabited by shady looking couples whispering sweet nothings to each other.
Sizzle is an experience restaurant with a great selection of meats and even decent vegetarian. Everything is served sizzling, even the drinks.
name: The Sizzle
Shanghai Terrace
address: 811, Kotte Road, Ethul Kotte, Sri Lanka.
description: Shanghai Terrace is a Chinese Restaurant that recently opened up in Ethul Kotte. They serve up some good looking Chinese food at a reasonable price. There is a charming little terrace on the roof top (hence the name Shanghai Terrace) accompanying a slightly dodgy looking bar. The service was really good and the food - not too bad either.

name: Korean Barbecue KBQ
description: KBQ in Rajagiriya does fried chicken and noodles, with a Korean twist.

name: Acropol
description: Acropol Restaurant which formerly resided on R.A De Mel Mawatha has moved to a new location on Galle Road, Colombo 03. If you're a fan of shawarmas it's worth a visit.

name: Shanghai Terrace
address: 811, Kotte Road, Ethul Kotte, Sri Lanka.
description: Shanghai Terrace is a Chinese Restaurant that recently opened up in Ethul Kotte. They serve up some good looking Chinese food at a reasonable price. There is a charming little terrace on the roof top (hence the name Shanghai Terrace) accompanying a slightly dodgy looking bar. The service was really good and the food - not too bad either.

name: Flower Drum (Battaramulla)
description: CLOSED. The Flower Drum in Pelawatte sits on top of HSBC Bank and Perera and Sons; a small and convenient restaurant for the occasional dinners with friends or family, although probably not the most ideal place to take a date for a romantic dinner. The service was really good when we went in, and the food – delicious.

name: Sovereign German Restaurant
description: Sovereign German Restaurant is pretty good. They serve extremely hearty German fare in a kitschy but welcoming location in Nugegoda.

name: Burgers Hut
address: Allen Avenue, Dehiwala (Opposite Nawalanka Food City)
description: Burger's Hut in Dehiwala was the first of the Burger's King clones, but a good one at that. We dropped in again after a while and we're happy to see that their burgers are still tasty and cheap. Unlike Burger's King though, BH is open from 1 pm.

name: China Doll
description: China Doll, once a fresh entry into the Chinese Restaurant tamasha is no longer the jaw dropping experience it once was.

name: Summer Garden
description: Summer Garden on Green Path is a popular watering hole among men. It's not much for ambience, but they do some affordable, hearty meat dishes.

name: Lion Pub
description: The Lion Pub has the best entrance of any bar in Colombo and really cheap beer and good food in large portions

Clean and untouched Kadiyanlena/Kataboola falls is truly an amazing place to visit. It is quite famous among local waterfall hunters and a must see place if you are a nature lover. Kadiyanlena is located in Nawalapitiya, precisely in Kadiyanlena village. This is near Hatton, Nuwara Eliya and Kandy.
name: Kadiyanlena Falls (Nawalapitiya)

description: Heladiva is a bath kade style restaurant housed in a beautiful old bungalow on Hunupitiya Lake Road serving authentic Sri Lankan cuisine.
name: Heladiva
Cheers (Cinnamon Grand)
address: Cinnamon Grand, Shri Uttarananda Road, Colombo 3
description: Cheers at Cinnamon Grand has been a mainstay in Colombo's pub scene for a while now. The food sticks to the usual English Pub food, and they do a satisfying job with it though the service was pretty darn slow in our case.

name: Baghdad Nights
description: Baghdad Nights is an Arabic restaurant with a great location and ambiance but mediocre to bad food. It's new so we'll give it some time to mature.
Heladiva is a bath kade style restaurant housed in a beautiful old bungalow on Hunupitiya Lake Road serving authentic Sri Lankan cuisine.
name: Heladiva

description: What a vibrant new place to stop at to get a bite to eat on the way out of Colombo... Cafe J - the newest eatery to hit the livening Negombo strip. Belonging to the Jetwing Group, this juice bar/patisserie/cafe is bright, clean and stylish, opening out onto the road on one side and the ocean on the other.
name: Cafe J

description: The colonial forts of Sri Lanka are a highlight for many tourists. The charming city of Galle Fort has been wonderfully restored while Jaffna’s fort sits in ruin, allowing visitors to haphazardly climb over stones. Having visited most of the forts in the country, my favorite is Fort Frederick in Trincomalee
name: The Temples Of Fort Frederick

description: The Fishing Huts is a set of cabins built during British days, but it is not a fishing location any more. It is located at the edge of Mooray Estate in Maskeliya which spans over 3000 acres of land. The cabins are built on the bank of Baththulu-Oya, which separates the tea estate from the Adam's Peak Wilderness Sanctuary.
name: The Fishing Huts (Maskeliya)

description: Bakeamazing is another one of Colombo's many, many homebakers. They sell great brownies, cookies and general sugary desserts as well as savoury bites like rolls and buns.
name: Bakeamazing

description: Water World is South Asia’s first underwater tunnel aquarium and is the only public aquarium in Sri Lanka. Despite the name, the attraction is actually a combination of two parks, the aquarium and a bird park.
name: Water World & Bird Park (Kelaniya)
Shiraz
description: Shiraz is a great new restaurant on Stratford Avenue serving Iranian cuisine upon the old upper floors of Gandhara. At the moment they're only open for dinner, which is served buffet style and costs around Rs. 1500 per head for copious portions of meat, rice and mezze

name: Indian Hut Family Restaurant
description: Indian Hut offers decent and affordable North Indian and Chinese cuisine in Galle
Carnival is a Sri Lankan institution, serving not great but cheap ice cream in an accessible and interesting location.
name: Carnival Ice Cream Parlour
Baghdad Nights
description: Baghdad Nights is an Arabic restaurant with a great location and ambiance but mediocre to bad food. It's new so we'll give it some time to mature.
Flower Shows at Water’s Edge Park
address: Waters Edge Limited 316, Ethul Kotte Road , Battaramulla , Sri Lanka.
name: The Flower Market (Battaramulla)

description: Carnival is a Sri Lankan institution, serving not great but cheap ice cream in an accessible and interesting location.
name: Carnival Ice Cream Parlour
Shiraz
description: Shiraz is a great new restaurant on Stratford Avenue serving Iranian cuisine upon the old upper floors of Gandhara. At the moment they're only open for dinner, which is served buffet style and costs around Rs. 1500 per head for copious portions of meat, rice and mezze
All in all it was a decent and quite satisfying meal. If you are looking for a cheap, decent place to get your lunchtime fix, we recommend making the trip.
name: Bo Sevana

description: Located in Kitulgala, the Kitulgala Rest House is just over two hours by car, or about three hours by bus, from Colombo. With a touch of 'old-world charm' the rest house is the perfect place to relax in style after a day of whitewater or hiking in what's fast becoming Sri Lanka's adventure capital
name: The Bridge Restaurant
Sky Lounge (Kingsbury)
description: Kingsbury's rooftop bar serves up a stunning view and pricey drinks.

name: The Mango Tree
description: Mango Tree is a hugely popular Indian restaurant on Dharmapala Mawatha, serving mainly North Indian cuisine. The food is very rich, and quite good.
Paan Paan makes great bread which turns into great sandwiches, melts. etc. It's not cheap but you're getting good, healthy value for money.
name: Paan Paan Sandwich Bar

description: Alumka Caterers have been very successful since they opened up their take out restaurant in Battaramulla several years ago. They offer a variety of food from Rice and Curry and Chinese Fried Rice Packets to Kotthu, Hoppers and even Vegetable Rotti and Wadè. Nowadays, come dinner time, you will find their little hole in the wall frenzied by crowds of hungry people.
address: Pannipitiya Road, Sri Jayawardenepura Kotte, Sri Lanka
name: Alumka Food Cabin
The Mango Tree
description: Mango Tree is a hugely popular Indian restaurant on Dharmapala Mawatha, serving mainly North Indian cuisine. The food is very rich, and quite good.

name: California Grill (Galadari)
description: California Grill is one of the city's older fine dining restaurants, located at the rooftop of the Galadari Hotel. They serve a selection of seafood, steak and grills as well as a variety of flambé dishes.
Saraswathie Lodge is another pure-veg South Indian spot on Galle Rd in Bambalapitiya. The ambience isn't as charming as nearby Greenlands Hotel but the thosai is marginally better.
name: Saraswathie Lodge (Bambalapitiya)
LeeSH
description: A charming little sandwich bar owned by the loveliest couple with delicious food.

name: Orchid Restaurant
description: if youre one of those who've not ventured further into Fort than a night at Dutch-Hos, this is a good place to start.

name: Buba Restaurant And Beach Club
description: Buba Restaurant and Beach Club is one of Colombo's older beach hangouts. They've got pretty secluded part of Mt.Lavinia beach to themselves, seafood is decent plus its mostly BYOB ;).

address: 51/1 Si Chittampalam A Gardiner Mawatha, Colombo 2
name: Colombo Rowing Club
Amrith
description: Amrith has moved to a new location. The food is still consistent and while they aren't the best in town, they're still a valid option for Indian food.

name: Cafe Michaelangelo
description: Thin crust, wood-fired pizza, with toppings like Pol Sambol. Michaelangelo is good for delivery, if you're really patient.

name: Skky Bar
address: 42 Sir M. M. M. Mawatha, Colombo 3
description: Skky Bar is actually rather good - even despite the unflattering light of day. The service is superb - the bouncers/staff are sweet, helpful and non douchey - and the cocktails are some of the best we've had in Colombo.

BreadTalk. We've been there a few times. And on every visit I'm strangely drawn to the polished, round buns, the cheesy breads, the flaky danishes - and each time, I come away disappointed - like a sad, slightly singed moth.
address: Ven Baddegama Wimalawansa Mawatha, Colombo, Sri Lanka
name: BreadTalk (Lipton Circus)
Rocco's
description: Rocco's has a good dine-in restaurant in Rajagiriya serving wood-fired pizza with a wide range of toppings.

Chopsticks is a down to earth joint in Nawala serving a vast menu of cheerfully Sri Lankanised Chinese food. Fried rice, devilled chicken, black bean pork and so on - the Sino-Lankan side of the menu is huge, and most of what we devoured was incredibly satisfying
name: Chopsticks

description: This has long been among the most exciting restaurants in the city. Not because of its cutting edge cuisine but because, for years, this was the only place to eat at Katunayake (BIA) airport. So a meal at the Palm Strip meant you were going places.
name: Palm Strip (At The Airport)

description: Ridi Vihara means silver temple. It was built by King Dutugemunu on the site of a great silver ore deposit. That silver was used for the Ruwanwelisaya stupa in Anuradhapura, but the temple here is still quite a sight.
name: Ridi Vihara (Photos By Dominic Sansoni)

description: Sweet Tomato Halal Family Restaurant is a decent if slightly expensive option in Pettah, across from the Red Mosque. Down 2nd Cross Street, this clean and friendly establishment serves a decent biriyani at the rather high price of Rs. 400. They also do fried rice and rice and curry.
name: Sweet Tomato
Amaravathi Restaurant
description: Amaravathi is a non-vegetarian South Indian restaurant located on a narrow street off the Galle road, serving great thosas, thalis and one of the country's best biriyanis.
Its an unending quest for ever gooier centers and choclatier chocolate with the objective of staying ahead of the cutthroat competition.
name: Moreish
Taprobane (Cinnamon Grand)
description: Taprobane's dinner buffet is pretty awesome. For just Rs. 2200, the spread's large and the food's top quality. Highlights? Their egg hoppers and their chocolate fudge.

name: In On The Green
description: Inn On The Green is well known for it's British Pub-like atmosphere and Pub Quiz .

BreadTalk. We've been there a few times. And on every visit I'm strangely drawn to the polished, round buns, the cheesy breads, the flaky danishes - and each time, I come away disappointed - like a sad, slightly singed moth.
address: Ven Baddegama Wimalawansa Mawatha, Colombo, Sri Lanka
name: BreadTalk (Lipton Circus)

description: There is a coastal road from Colombo to Negombo which, while not especially fast, is really quite scenic and worth a drive. It begins as you take the bridge out of Mattakuliya and proceed along the canal. It then continues along the coast all the way to Negombo.
name: The Old Colombo/Negombo Road

description: Nestled in a deserted corner of Trincomalee Harbor, The Dutch Bank Café, is the first luxury restaurant to be opened since the end of the troubles.
address: 88 Inner Harbour Road, Trincomalee, Sri Lanka
name: The Dutch Bank Café

description: Copper Chimney, the Hunupitiya branch appears to be the original in what has now become a franchise. This is an underrated lunch time only fried-rice kade.
name: Copper Chimney (Hunupitiya)

description: Mutwal's licensed Toddy Tavern is one of Colombo's few locations where you can grab a legal bowl of ra - that milky, lightly soda-flavoured coconut liquor.
name: Toddy Tavern (Kotahena)
Sunlight Garden
description: Sunlight Garden is not one of the most popular Chinese restaurants in Colombo, but we don't really understand why. They've got good food, huge portions and great value for money.

name: Cafe On The 5th
description: Cafe On The 5th has been a local favourite for years, serving tasty food in a comfortable al fresco style atmosphere. Their quality has taken a nose-dive recently, though.
Cioconat offers some tasty, generous fare, but even so it still isn’t exactly where it could be.
name: Cioconat Lounge (CLOSED)

description: Elephant House Fountain Cafe is a photocopy of a once historical watering hole. John Keells bought Elephant House and shut down 'non-performing' brands like the once popular Fountain Cafe, only reopening the place recently. Now the fountain is still there but the cafe is wedged behind a supermarket, literally at the end of aisle 10.
address: Dr Colvin R de Silva Mawatha, Colombo 2
name: Fountain Cafe
Yakitori Garden (Nihonbashi)
description: Colombo's fine dining Japanese restaurant Nihonbashi has recently turned their outdoor dining section into a 'Yakitori Garden' - a small, bamboo-framed nook serving skewered, charcoal-grilled entrails out in the open and straight off the coals
The ultimate Colombo street sweet.
name: Bombai Muttai Man

description: This place has a promising name, but the fried rice is not very good at all. Costs Rs. 150 for lunch, which includes rice, some vegetable thing, slices of pineapple and cucumber and some chicken fried within an inch of its life.
name: Wok In A Box
Banana Leaf
description: They do chicken biryani pretty darn good and now have crab and lamb on the menu.

Palmyrah has long been one of the best places in the city for Sri Lankan food. They've expanded well into Western and Indian too, the food is great, and it's also a comfy, quiet, chilled space to dine at.
name: Palmyrah (Hotel Renuka)
Gerard Mendis Chocolatier
description: Gerard Mendis Chocolatier is a fancy chocolate manufacturer on Horton Place that also offers a range of other desserts. While they charge a premium for their bite-sized chocolates, we found very little we actually enjoyed, and wished we had gone for a bar of Snickers instead. (And as for their cheesecake, don’t even get us started.)

name: Flower Song
description: If you’re passing through or spending some time in the second city and looking for a place to eat that isn’t Devon or the Muslim Hotel- try this.
Its an unending quest for ever gooier centers and choclatier chocolate with the objective of staying ahead of the cutthroat competition.
name: Moreish

description: Colombo wants for good Italian options. While there’s no lack of Italian restaurants none of them quite does justice to the real gusti d’italia  It’s not that Bayleaf, Il Ponte, Echo are bad exactly – just that they aren’t quite good enough. On occasion though Colombo’s wannabe trattorias can surprise you with the quality of their cooking. The other day we stepped into Echo and discovered they serve up a very respectable anti pasti buffet for Rs. 1200+.
name: Echo (Cinnamon Grand)
Nihonbashi Honten
description: Not just the city's best Japanese restaurant, but one of the city's most seminal eateries, full stop.
The ultimate Colombo street sweet.
name: Bombai Muttai Man

description: Avirate is a Sri Lankan fashion chain that's the first to move into what we call Dutch Hospital 2, the refurbished set of buildings behind the now iconic Dutch Hospital.
name: Avirate (Behind Dutch Hospital)

description: There aren’t too many places in the world where one can sit down for a 24 course meal in a supposedly high-end restaurant for $20. This is, de facto, a fun experience and the knowledge that your wallet will emerge relatively unscathed provides a constant sop to the disappointment the taste buds feel as each course emerges.
address: Cinnamon Grand, Shri Uttarananda Road, Colombo 3
name: Tao (Cinnamon Grand)

description: when the mood for plug, press, play and tune out entertainment strikes me I find my self making a beeline to The Classic Entertainment on the Galle Road at Colpetty
name: The Classic Entertainment

description: Copper Chimney, the Hunupitiya branch appears to be the original in what has now become a franchise. This is an underrated lunch time only fried-rice kade.
name: Copper Chimney (Hunupitiya)
Buba Restaurant And Beach Club
description: Buba Restaurant and Beach Club is one of Colombo's older beach hangouts. They've got pretty secluded part of Mt.Lavinia beach to themselves, seafood is decent plus its mostly BYOB ;).

name: Adma Agro
description: Adma Agro in Nuwara Eliya is well known for their fresh strawberries and strawberry products. The store itself isn't in the best shape, but thankfully their desserts are still pretty tasty.
Formerly known as Walkers Cafe, The Canteen hasn't changed much at all but their hoppers are excellent.
name: The Canteen

description: Sen Saal was one of the very first large scale bakeries to establish themselves in Battaramulla. Since then they have added a restaurant at the back where they serve things like Lasgna, Rice and Curry, Nasi Goreng, Fried Rice and even the elusive Lamprais. They also do submarines and fresh fruit juices. Having lived in Battaramulla for so many years now, I was excited about writing a good review to rep the town. But oh my god, this is going to be the furthest thing from a good review!
name: Sen Saal (Battaramulla)
Green Cabin
description: Providing the city with crispy white hoppers and tongue burning katta sambol for well over 60 years, Green Cabin is one of Colombo's older, more venerable eating establishments.

name: Klassy (Battaramulla)
description: Short eats in Battaramulla? Klassy’s is King.

name: Hotel Top Form
description: Hotel Top Form is an Indian restaurant under the Nugegoda flyover. It's OK, the lunch packets are not especially good but we hear good things about the tandoori.
Paan Paan makes great bread which turns into great sandwiches, melts. etc. It's not cheap but you're getting good, healthy value for money.
name: Paan Paan Sandwich Bar

description: Pasta Hut is an Italian restaurant and pizzeria in Nugegoda of all places, near the Jubilee Post junction. It does surprisingly good ravioli and pasta and pizzas (we assume, haven't tried them yet). The location is a bit noisy and uncomfortable for dine-in but we recommend them for delivery or take-away.
name: Pasta Hut

description: The jogging track opposite the Sri Lankan Parliament (Japan Friendship Road) has been a marvelous success at gathering large crowds of people. Covering a distance of 1880M, it is probably the longest track in the vicinity of Colombo, not to mention one of the most picturesque; solar powered lights span the length of the course creating a beautiful skyline by night.
name: Diyawanna Jogging Track

description: The Diyawanna Ferry Service (actually a boat service) run by the Sri Lanka Navy is an excellent new addition to the diversions available to Colombars and visitors. It is the best way to see Sri Lanka’s Parliament from all angles, since the boat does a full circle of the iconic Bawa building.
name: Diyawanna Boat Rides

description: Alumka Caterers have been very successful since they opened up their take out restaurant in Battaramulla several years ago. They offer a variety of food from Rice and Curry and Chinese Fried Rice Packets to Kotthu, Hoppers and even Vegetable Rotti and Wadè. Nowadays, come dinner time, you will find their little hole in the wall frenzied by crowds of hungry people.
address: Pannipitiya Road, Sri Jayawardenepura Kotte, Sri Lanka
name: Alumka Food Cabin
Echelon Pub (RIP)
address: 2 Sir Chittampalam A. Gardiner Mawatha, Colombo 2
description: Echelon Pub has good pub food, cold beer and excellent service. It's not cheap but it's a reliable night out.

name: Devon Bakeaway (Nugegoda)
